original: ri rab lhun po ri'i rgyal po'i nye logs na glang po'i sde zhes bya @230b bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po dang / lha ma yin gyi dbang po zhes bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po dang / gzhon pa dkar po zhes bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po dang /
analyzed: ri rab lhun po ri'i rgyal po'i nye logs na glang po'i sde zhes bya @230b bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po dang / lha ma yin gyi dbang po zhes bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po dang / gzhon pa dkar po zhes bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po dang /
translated: Near the king of mountains Meru are the vidyadhara kings called “Elephant Army,” “King of the Asuras,” and “Youthful White One.”

original: cha byad bzang po zhes bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po dang / gser gyi yan lag ces bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po dang / padma bkod pa'i rgyan ces bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po dang / rdo rje'i phyag ces bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po dang /
analyzed: cha byad bzang po zhes bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po dang / gser gyi yan lag ces bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po dang / padma bkod pa'i rgyan ces bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po dang / rdo rje'i phyag ces bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po dang /
translated: the vidyādhara king called Good Appearance, the vidyādhara king called Golden Limbs, the vidyādhara king called Array of Lotus Ornaments, the vidyādhara king called Vajra Hands,

original: rin chen kun tu snang ba zhes bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po dang / zhags pa'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po dang / me lce 'bar ba'i 'od ces bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po dang / sgyu 'phrul kun tu ston pa zhes bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po dang /
analyzed: rin chen kun tu snang ba zhes bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po dang / zhags pa'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po dang / me lce 'bar ba'i 'od ces bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po dang / sgyu 'phrul kun tu ston pa zhes bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po dang /
translated: the vidyādhara king called Completely Illuminating Jewel, the vidyādhara king called Lasso Mudrā, the vidyādhara king called Blazing Firelight, and the vidyādhara king called Displaying Illusions.

original: rtag tu rab dga' zhes bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po dang / rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po bco brgyad po 'di rnams rig pa 'dzin pa stong phrag bcu bzhis yongs su bskor ba mthu chen po dang ldan pa de rnams thams cad kyang bud med rnams kyis lhan cig rtse bar byed /
analyzed: rtag tu rab dga' zhes bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po dang / rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po bco brgyad po 'di rnams rig pa 'dzin pa stong phrag bcu bzhis yongs su bskor ba mthu chen po dang ldan pa de rnams thams cad kyang bud med rnams kyis lhan cig rtse bar byed /
translated: The king of vidyādharas, always called ‘Joyful,’ and these eighteen kings of vidyādharas, surrounded by ten thousand vidyādharas, are endowed with great power. All of them play with women,

original: dga' bar byed /
analyzed: dga' bar byed /
translated: enjoy themselves,

original: dga' dgur spyod par byed do //
analyzed: dga' dgur spyod par byed do //
translated: and do as they please.

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽rig pa 'dzin pa 'di rnams skye ba bdun gyi nang du rig pa'i rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur ste gang dang / gang du skyes pa de dang / de nyid @231a *//
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / rig pa 'dzin pa 'di rnams skye ba bdun gyi nang du rig pa'i rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur ste gang dang / gang du skyes pa de dang / de nyid @231a *//
translated: Son of noble family,🔽these vidyādharas will follow the vidyā for seven lifetimes. Wherever they are born,

original: du rig pa 'di'i mthus dran pa so sor rnyed do //
analyzed: du rig pa 'di'i mthus dran pa so sor rnyed do //
translated: there they will attain the recollection of this vidyā through its power.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de lta bu'i gnas su gnas pas rig pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gnas su gnas pas rig pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: by abiding in such a place, the vidyā will be accomplished.

original: de nas lha dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor de rnams ngo mtshar thob nas bcom ldan 'das la rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i me tog gis mngon par gtor bar gyur to; ;de nas lha thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rab tu dga' ba'i yid kyis rig pas dga' ba'i don du cho ga gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas lha dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor de rnams ngo mtshar thob nas bcom ldan 'das la rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i me tog gis mngon par gtor bar gyur to; ;de nas lha thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rab tu dga' ba'i yid kyis rig pas dga' ba'i don du cho ga gsungs so //
translated: Then, the assembly of gods and bodhisattvas, having attained wonder, scattered various flowers upon the Blessed One. Then, all the gods and bodhisattvas, with joyful minds, spoke the ritual for the purpose of delighting with knowledge.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' des rig sngags gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' des rig sngags gsungs pa /
translated: Then, that bodhisattva spoke the knowledge mantra:

original: aom padma badzri h'um snying po'o //
analyzed: aom padma badzri h'um snying po'o //
translated: Om padma vajri hum, the essence.

original: ga ga na bi d'a ri ni /
analyzed: ga ga na bi d'a ri ni /
translated: Gagana vidari ni,

original: nye ba'i snying po'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i snying po'o //
translated: the near essence.

original: aom bha ya n'a sa ni phat/
analyzed: aom bha ya n'a sa ni phat/
translated: Om bhaya nasani phat,

original: mgo bo'o // aom tri pa ni h'um/
analyzed: mgo bo'o // aom tri pa ni h'um/
translated: the head. Om tripani hum,

original: gtsug tor du'o //🔽aom ta ti h'um/🔽go cha'o // aom bee ta ti h'um/
analyzed: gtsug tor du'o // aom ta ti h'um/ go cha'o // aom bee ta ti h'um/
translated: in the ushnisha.🔽 Om tati hum,🔽 the armor. Om vaitati hum,

original: gur ro // aom sve te dza ti ni phat/
analyzed: gur ro // aom sve te dza ti ni phat/
translated: the tent. Om sveta jati ni phat,🔽 the fence.

original: ra ba'o // zhes pa 'di dag rig pa'i 'khor gyi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: ra ba'o // zhes pa 'di dag rig pa'i 'khor gyi lhag ma'o //
translated: These are the remainder of the knowledge retinue.

original: rtsa ba'i rig pa nyid kyis dri dang / me tog bdug pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rig pa nyid kyis dri dang / me tog bdug pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The root awareness itself is the incense, flowers, and so forth.

original: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis bcom ldan 'das ma'i ras ris kyi cho ga gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis bcom ldan 'das ma'i ras ris kyi cho ga gsungs so //
translated: Then again, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara taught the ritual of the painting of the Blessed Lady.

original: dang po re zhig tshad med cing skra dang bral ba'i ras bkrus pa /
analyzed: dang po re zhig tshad med cing skra dang bral ba'i ras bkrus pa /
translated: First, one should wash a cloth that is immeasurable and free from hair,

original: tsandan dkar po dang / aa ga ru'i @231b 'dab ma spang spos dang lhan cig sbyar ba /
analyzed: tsandan dkar po dang / aa ga ru'i @231b 'dab ma spang spos dang lhan cig sbyar ba /
translated: with white sandalwood, agalloch, and spṛkkā leaves mixed together.

original: bcom ldan 'das mas lan bdun mngon par sngags pas lan bdun bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mas lan bdun mngon par sngags pas lan bdun bkru bar bya'o //
translated: One should wash it seven times, incanting it seven times with the Blessed Lady.

original: bkrus pa la'ang byug par bya'o //
analyzed: bkrus pa la'ang byug par bya'o //
translated: One should also anoint the washed [cloth].

original: 'byung po'i skra dang / ga dza hva dang / sha tru gha ni dang / pri yang ku ste 'di rnams kyis bdug par bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung po'i skra dang / ga dza hva dang / sha tru gha ni dang / pri yang ku ste 'di rnams kyis bdug par bya'o //
translated: One should fumigate it with the hair of bhūtas, gajapipīlikā, śatrumghnī, and priyaṅgu.

original: 'di rnams kyis gang 'dod pa de grub par mtshon no //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis gang 'dod pa de grub par mtshon no //
translated: It is indicated that whatever one desires is accomplished by these.

original: mtshan mo gcig smyung bar gnas par gyur nas mi blo dang ldan pas mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo gcig smyung bar gnas par gyur nas mi blo dang ldan pas mnyan par bya'o //
translated: Having fasted for one night, the wise one should listen.

original: de nas tho rangs dang / mtshan mo me sbar nas rang gi khrag gis btags pa'i yungs kar gyi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya'o //
analyzed: de nas tho rangs dang / mtshan mo me sbar nas rang gi khrag gis btags pa'i yungs kar gyi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgya bya'o //
translated: Then, at dawn and at night, one should make a homa offering of one thousand and eight mustard seeds smeared with one’s own blood.

original: cho ga 'di nyid kyis ras ris 'dri bzhin pa la bgegs mi 'byung ngo //🔽de bas kyang byung bar bya ste rnam pa gzhan du na log 'dren gyis byin gyis brlabs pas grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cho ga 'di nyid kyis ras ris 'dri bzhin pa la bgegs mi 'byung ngo // de bas kyang byung bar bya ste rnam pa gzhan du na log 'dren gyis byin gyis brlabs pas grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By this very rite, obstacles will not occur while the painting is being made.🔽If they do occur, one should make a homa offering of one thousand and eight oblations of sesame seeds smeared with curds, honey, and ghee.

original: de nas rig pa 'dzin pa rang nyid kyis rig sngags zlos bzhin pas ri mo mkhan khrus byed du gzhug go /
analyzed: de nas rig pa 'dzin pa rang nyid kyis rig sngags zlos bzhin pas ri mo mkhan khrus byed du gzhug go /
translated: Then, the master of the ritual himself, reciting the mantra, should make the painter bathe.

original: bkrus nas de la'ang gos rab tu sbyin par bya ste ji srid 'dri ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: bkrus nas de la'ang gos rab tu sbyin par bya ste ji srid 'dri ba'i bar ro //
translated: After the bathing, he should also give him clothes, until the painting is finished.

original: ri mo mkhan gso sbyong la gnas par bya zhing 'dri bzhin pa na'ang ras kyi mthar rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i gtor ma dbul bar bya zhing bum pa gang ba bzhi bzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: ri mo mkhan gso sbyong la gnas par bya zhing 'dri bzhin pa na'ang ras kyi mthar rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i gtor ma dbul bar bya zhing bum pa gang ba bzhi bzhag par bya'o //
translated: The painter should observe the purificatory fast. While the painting is being made, various kinds of bali offerings should be made at the edge of the cloth, and four full vases should be placed.

original: dbus su'ang dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa bya'o //
analyzed: dbus su'ang dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa bya'o //
translated: In the middle, a square maṇḍala should be made.

original: der yang bum pa gang ba gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: der yang bum pa gang ba gzhag par bya'o //
translated: There, too, one should place filled vases.

original: bum pa de rnams @232a *//
analyzed: bum pa de rnams @232a *//
translated: All those vases

original: thams cad kyang me tog gis brgyan par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang me tog gis brgyan par bya'o //
translated: should be adorned with flowers.

original: mar me'i phreng ba'ang dbul lo //
analyzed: mar me'i phreng ba'ang dbul lo //
translated: One should also offer garlands of lamps.

original: rig pa 'dzin pas rig pa yid la byed cing bdug spos bsreg par bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pas rig pa yid la byed cing bdug spos bsreg par bya'o //
translated: The vidyādhara should keep the vidyā in mind and burn incense.

original: de nas ri mo mkhan gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag byas nas tshangs pa'i ri mo gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ri mo mkhan gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag byas nas tshangs pa'i ri mo gdab par bya'o //
translated: Then the painter, having paid homage to all the tathāgatas and bodhisattvas, should begin the painting, starting with Brahmā.

original: de nas slar yang rig pa 'dzin pas kha shar du mngon par phyogs las nye bar zhugs nas ras ris kyi spyan sngar aa p'a marga'i yam shing gis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: de nas slar yang rig pa 'dzin pas kha shar du mngon par phyogs las nye bar zhugs nas ras ris kyi spyan sngar aa p'a marga'i yam shing gis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: Then, again, the vidyādhara, facing east, should approach and perform in front of the painting eight thousand oblations with sticks of the crown flower plant.

original: de nas ri mo mkhan gyis lha la phul ba'i ston mo zos pas ma 'dres pa'i tshon gyis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od dpag med kyi gzugs brnyan 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ri mo mkhan gyis lha la phul ba'i ston mo zos pas ma 'dres pa'i tshon gyis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od dpag med kyi gzugs brnyan 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Then the painter should eat the feast offered to the deity and paint the image of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Amitābha with unmixed colors.

original: gser mdog padma dkar po'i gdan la bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gser mdog padma dkar po'i gdan la bzhugs pa'o //
translated: He should be seated on a white lotus with a golden complexion.

original: g-yas su 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ston ka'i sprin ltar dkar ba la ral pa'i cod pan 'phyang ba /
analyzed: g-yas su 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ston ka'i sprin ltar dkar ba la ral pa'i cod pan 'phyang ba /
translated: To the right, one should paint the noble Avalokiteśvara, white as an autumn cloud, with a topknot of matted hair hanging down.

original: spyan gsum pa /
analyzed: spyan gsum pa /
translated: He has three eyes

original: dpral ba nas 'od zer 'byung ba /
analyzed: dpral ba nas 'od zer 'byung ba /
translated: and light rays emerge from his forehead.

original: padma la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: padma la gnas pa'o //
translated: He is seated on a lotus.

original: de'i rgyab tu rig pa'i lha mo gos dkar po bgos pa /
analyzed: de'i rgyab tu rig pa'i lha mo gos dkar po bgos pa /
translated: Behind him, one should paint the knowledge goddess Pāṇḍaravāsinī,

original: padma rab tu 'thor bzhin pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: padma rab tu 'thor bzhin pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: as if scattering white lotuses.

original: de'i bar ma chad @232b par khro gnyer can ma gos dkar po 'chang ba 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bar ma chad @232b par khro gnyer can ma gos dkar po 'chang ba 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Between them, one should paint Bhṛkuṭī, wearing white garments.

original: g-yas su bcom ldan 'das ma thugs rje chen po bri yang ku ltar sngo bsangs /
analyzed: g-yas su bcom ldan 'das ma thugs rje chen po bri yang ku ltar sngo bsangs /
translated: To the right, one should paint the Blessed One Mahākaruṇika, blue like the color of bṛhatī flowers,

original: phyag na rin po che bsnams pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag na rin po che bsnams pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: He should be painted holding a jewel.

original: de nas thams cad kyang bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gi tshad du bya zhing padma la gnas shing so sor gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de nas thams cad kyang bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gi tshad du bya zhing padma la gnas shing so sor gnas pa'o //
translated: Then all of them should be made one cubit tall, standing on lotuses, and seated separately.

original: g-yon gyi gzhogs su phyag na rdo rje sngo bsangs rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: g-yon gyi gzhogs su phyag na rdo rje sngo bsangs rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: On the left side, one should paint the blue Vajrapāṇi, adorned with all the ornaments,

original: phyag na rdo rje bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje bsnams pa'o //
translated: holding a vajra.

original: g-yon gyi gzhogs su rig pa'i rgyal po dam pa rma bya la nye bar 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon gyi gzhogs su rig pa'i rgyal po dam pa rma bya la nye bar 'dug pa'o //
translated: On the left side, one should paint the excellent knowledge king seated on a peacock,

original: rig pa'i rgyal po'i nye logs su gser ldan ma'ang rdo rje lcags kyu ma 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal po'i nye logs su gser ldan ma'ang rdo rje lcags kyu ma 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: and next to the knowledge king, one should paint Suvarṇākṣī, the vajra hook.

original: rdo rje khu tshur sngo bsangs rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa /🔽rdo rje bsnams pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur sngo bsangs rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa / rdo rje bsnams pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: One should paint Vajramuṣṭi, blue and adorned with all the ornaments,🔽holding a vajra.

original: rdo rje dbyug pa dbyug pa bsnams pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyug pa dbyug pa bsnams pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: One should paint Vajrādhipa, holding a club.

original: rdo rje blo gros rdo rje ma dang / gnam lcags ma'ang rdo rje dbyug pa'i rgyab tu 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje blo gros rdo rje ma dang / gnam lcags ma'ang rdo rje dbyug pa'i rgyab tu 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Vajramati, Vajra, and Vajra-thunderbolt should be painted behind Vajra-club.

original: g-yon du lha skrag pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yon du lha skrag pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: To the left, a god should be painted who is frightened.

original: sbrul gyi mchod phyir thogs pa can /
analyzed: sbrul gyi mchod phyir thogs pa can /
translated: He has a snake for an upper robe.

original: rdo rje drag tu dgod pa 'drir gzhug cing phyag na rdo rje'i nye logs su rdo rje sde dang / gtsug 'phyang rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje drag tu dgod pa 'drir gzhug cing phyag na rdo rje'i nye logs su rdo rje sde dang / gtsug 'phyang rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Vajra-laughter should be painted, and Vajra-army and Vajra-pendants, adorned with all ornaments, should be painted next to Vajrapāṇi.

original: thams cad @233a *//
analyzed: thams cad @233a *//
translated: All of them

original: kyang padma la so sor gnas pa'o //
analyzed: kyang padma la so sor gnas pa'o //
translated: are seated on lotuses.

original: rgyal po chen po bzhi bya ste log 'dren gyi rigs bzhi rnams rnam par 'gyur ba'i gzugs can /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bzhi bya ste log 'dren gyi rigs bzhi rnams rnam par 'gyur ba'i gzugs can /
translated: The four great kings should be painted, with the four kinds of Māra in transformed forms.

original: 'bros bzhin pa 'og tu bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'bros bzhin pa 'og tu bri bar bya'o //
translated: They should be painted fleeing below.

original: de rnams kyi 'og tu padma'i mtsho bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'og tu padma'i mtsho bya'o //
translated: Below them, a lotus lake should be painted.

original: klu lag na padma thogs pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: klu lag na padma thogs pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Nāgas holding lotuses in their hands should be painted.

original: lha'i tshogs thams cad kyang me tog rab tu 'thor bzhin pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: lha'i tshogs thams cad kyang me tog rab tu 'thor bzhin pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: All the hosts of gods should be depicted as if scattering flowers.

original: lha'i rnga bo che 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: lha'i rnga bo che 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: The great divine drum should be depicted.

original: tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug dang / dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa rnams kyang mtshon cha dang bcas pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug dang / dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa rnams kyang mtshon cha dang bcas pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Brahmā, Viṣṇu, Maheśvara, and so forth should be depicted with their weapons.

original: rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po lus med 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po lus med 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: The king of vidyādharas should be depicted without a body.

original: klu'i rgyal po'i nye logs su sgrub pa po lag na spos phor thogs pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po'i nye logs su sgrub pa po lag na spos phor thogs pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: The practitioner should be depicted holding an incense burner next to the king of nāgas.

original: ras ris 'di bris pa tsam nyid kyis sdig pa thams cad las grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ras ris 'di bris pa tsam nyid kyis sdig pa thams cad las grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Merely by painting this painting, one will be freed from all sins.

original: phyi nas lha rnams bde blag tu sgrub bo //
analyzed: phyi nas lha rnams bde blag tu sgrub bo //
translated: Subsequently, the gods will be easily accomplished.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i rgyal mo chen po'i le'u dang po rdzogs so ////

analyzed: sku mdog dkar po /

analyzed: phyag g-yon pas ku rba 'dzin pa'i snying po mchog bcom ldan 'das ma'i nye logs su 'drir gzhug par bya'o //

analyzed: lha'i rnga po che 'drir gzhug par bya'o //

analyzed: dkar gsum za zhing ras ris kyi spyan sngar rig pa 'bum phrag bdun bzlas par bya'o //

analyzed: @236a *// de lta bu sngon spyad pa byas par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de nas rig pa 'dzin pas yid kyis mchod yon dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Then the vidyādhara should mentally offer a welcome drink.

original: slar yang du ba 'thul ba dang / 'bar bar gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: slar yang du ba 'thul ba dang / 'bar bar gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Again, one should recite the mantra until it smokes, flames, and burns.

original: 'bar ba dang blangs nas skra li zhing 'khyil ba /
analyzed: 'bar ba dang blangs nas skra li zhing 'khyil ba /
translated: Having taken it when it burns, one’s hair will become disheveled and curly.

original: lo brgyad gnyis lon pa'i rnam pa can /
analyzed: lo brgyad gnyis lon pa'i rnam pa can /
translated: He will have the form of an eight- or twelve-year-old,

original: rig pa 'dzin pa bcu drug gis yongs su bskor bar 'gyur te lo stong phrag brgyad cu 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa bcu drug gis yongs su bskor bar 'gyur te lo stong phrag brgyad cu 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: surrounded by the sixteen knowledge-holders, and will live for eighty thousand years.

original: gang gi tshe 'chi ba de'i tshe rdo rje'i rigs su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'chi ba de'i tshe rdo rje'i rigs su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When he dies, he will be reborn in the Vajra family.

original: tshes grangs mi dgos /
analyzed: tshes grangs mi dgos /
translated: No lunar day is required.🔽No lunar mansion is required.

original: rgyu skar mi dgos /🔽smyung bar gnas pa mi dgos te skyes bu rgya mtsho'i 'gram du mgo bo shar du bzhag nas shi @236b ba'i ro blangs nas dri dang / me tog la sogs pas brgyan par byas nas sgrub pa po kha shar du phyogs pas re re la so sor bsam pa'i yid kyi rgyud mtshungs pa'i ba'i mar gsar la rig pa bzlas pas ro'i kha ru blugs nas ji srid kun tu g-yo zhing ldang ba de
analyzed: rgyu skar mi dgos / smyung bar gnas pa mi dgos te skyes bu rgya mtsho'i 'gram du mgo bo shar du bzhag nas shi @236b ba'i ro blangs nas dri dang / me tog la sogs pas brgyan par byas nas sgrub pa po kha shar du phyogs pas re re la so sor bsam pa'i yid kyi rgyud mtshungs pa'i ba'i mar gsar la rig pa bzlas pas ro'i kha ru blugs nas ji srid kun tu g-yo zhing ldang ba de
translated: No fasting is required.

original: srid du rig pa bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: srid du rig pa bzlas par bya'o //
translated: The practitioner should take the corpse of a person who died on the seashore, facing east, adorned with perfumes, flowers, and so on, and facing east, with a mind focused on each one, he should pour fresh butter into the corpse's mouth, enchanted with the knowledge mantra, and recite the knowledge mantra as long as the corpse moves and rises.

original: de nas rig pa 'dzin pas rgya mtshor 'jug par bya ste ji srid nyi ma 'char bar 'gyur ba de srid du chur gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rig pa 'dzin pas rgya mtshor 'jug par bya ste ji srid nyi ma 'char bar 'gyur ba de srid du chur gnas par bya'o //
translated: Then the vidyādhara should enter the ocean and remain in the water for as long as the sun rises.

original: de tsam gyis skra li zhing 'khyil ba lo brgyad lon pa'i rnam pa can sems bskyed pas 'di'i phyag cha thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de tsam gyis skra li zhing 'khyil ba lo brgyad lon pa'i rnam pa can sems bskyed pas 'di'i phyag cha thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By that much, his hair will become curly and coiled, and he will have the appearance of an eight-year-old. By generating the mind [of awakening], all his implements will appear.

original: lo stong phrag drug cur 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo stong phrag drug cur 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will live for sixty thousand years.

original: dpag tshad stong phrag bcu gcig tu 'phur bar 'gyur ro //🔽thog phog ba'i shing las byung ba'i phyag na rdo rje byas la sman gyi gzugs kyi rnam pa'i bcom ldan 'das ma bri yang ku'i shing las byas pa snying po mnyam par 'gro ma byed du gzhug go ;spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug nim pa'i shing las byung ba
analyzed: dpag tshad stong phrag bcu gcig tu 'phur bar 'gyur ro // thog phog ba'i shing las byung ba'i phyag na rdo rje byas la sman gyi gzugs kyi rnam pa'i bcom ldan 'das ma bri yang ku'i shing las byas pa snying po mnyam par 'gro ma byed du gzhug go ;spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug nim pa'i shing las byung ba
translated: He will fly ten thousand leagues.🔽One should make Vajrapāṇi from wood struck by lightning, and draw the Blessed Lady in the form of a medicine. One should make Avalokiteśvara from nimba wood.

original: byed du gzhug go /
analyzed: byed du gzhug go /
translated: One should make Mañjuśrī from the wood of the bodhi tree.

original: thams cad kyang ban kan mthar byed kyi 'bras bu la so sor dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang ban kan mthar byed kyi 'bras bu la so sor dgod par bya'o //
translated: All of them should be placed on the fruit of the arka tree.

original: sgrub pa po pus mo btsugs pa lag na spog phor thogs pa byed du gzhug go /🔽de nas gos gtsang ma bgos te mi smra ba'i brtul zhugs kyi snying po mnyam par 'gro ma 'bum @237a *//
analyzed: sgrub pa po pus mo btsugs pa lag na spog phor thogs pa byed du gzhug go / de nas gos gtsang ma bgos te mi smra ba'i brtul zhugs kyi snying po mnyam par 'gro ma 'bum @237a *//
translated: The practitioner should be made to kneel and hold a ladle in his hand.

original: phrag bcu gcig tu bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: phrag bcu gcig tu bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, having put on clean clothes, he should recite the essence of the vow of silence, the Samayagāthā, 110,000 times.

original: de lta bu sngon spyad pa byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu sngon spyad pa byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, he will have performed the preliminary practice.

original: de nas bco lnga pas mtshan mo gsum smyung bar gnas te mandal dang bcas pa bza' zhing dge 'dun la ston mo dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bco lnga pas mtshan mo gsum smyung bar gnas te mandal dang bcas pa bza' zhing dge 'dun la ston mo dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Then, on the fifteenth day, he should fast for three nights, make a maṇḍala, and offer a feast to the saṅgha.

original: de nas mtshan mo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i gtor ma rnam pa sna tshogs pa rjes su dbul zhing mar me stong sbar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mtshan mo sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i gtor ma rnam pa sna tshogs pa rjes su dbul zhing mar me stong sbar bar bya'o //
translated: Then, at night, having made vast offerings to the Blessed Buddha, he should offer various kinds of bali with fruit, light one thousand butter lamps,🔽and recite the Samayagāthā 100,000 times.

original: de nas bsrung ba byas nas ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug ste autpa la'i phreng ba nyi shu byas te 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi phyag g-yas su phul la ji srid thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bsrung ba byas nas ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug ste autpa la'i phreng ba nyi shu byas te 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi phyag g-yas su phul la ji srid thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, having performed the protection rite, he should sit on a bundle of kuśa grass, make twenty garlands of utpala flowers, and offer them into the right hand of Ārya Avalokiteśvara. He should recite the mantra until he sees everything.

original: 'jigs par mi bya bar slar yang rig pa bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jigs par mi bya bar slar yang rig pa bzlas par bya'o //
translated: He should not be afraid, but should recite the vidyā again.

original: g-yo bar gyur pa dang / de dag blangs pas autpa la sngon po'i 'dab ma ltar sngo bsangs kyis rdo rje'i lus dang / rig pa 'dzin pa thams cad kyi skal ba bzang por 'gyur zhing lo stong phrag brgyad cur 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: g-yo bar gyur pa dang / de dag blangs pas autpa la sngon po'i 'dab ma ltar sngo bsangs kyis rdo rje'i lus dang / rig pa 'dzin pa thams cad kyi skal ba bzang por 'gyur zhing lo stong phrag brgyad cur 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When they move, he should take them. He will become blue like the petals of a blue lotus, with a vajra body, and will have the good fortune of all the vidyādharas, and will live for eighty thousand years.

original: dpag tshad stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhir lding bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpag tshad stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhir lding bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will fly for eighty-four yojanas.

original: gang gi tshe 'chi ba de'i tshe rdo rje'i rigs su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'chi ba de'i tshe rdo rje'i rigs su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When he dies, he will be reborn in the Vajra family.

original: ma nyams pa'i ras la ri mo mkhan gso sbyong @237b can gyis bcom ldan 'das ma khro gnyer can ma 'drir gzhug par bya ste sngo bsangs spyan gsum pa'i lha mo cha byad dang / rgyan ma nyams pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: ma nyams pa'i ras la ri mo mkhan gso sbyong @237b can gyis bcom ldan 'das ma khro gnyer can ma 'drir gzhug par bya ste sngo bsangs spyan gsum pa'i lha mo cha byad dang / rgyan ma nyams pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: “One should have a painter who observes the purificatory fast paint on linen that is not sold in the market the Blessed Lady Bhṛkuṭī. She should be painted green, with three eyes, and with her ornaments and attire intact.

original: 'og tu rjes su sgrub pa po lag na spog phor thogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: 'og tu rjes su sgrub pa po lag na spog phor thogs pa bya'o //
translated: “Below her, one should paint the practitioner holding a skull cup.

original: de nas sgrub pa pos ras ris kyi spyan sngar rig pa 'bum phrag gsum bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa pos ras ris kyi spyan sngar rig pa 'bum phrag gsum bzlas par bya'o //
translated: “Then, in front of the painting, the practitioner should recite the vidyā three hundred thousand times.🔽“Then, at night, one should go to a charnel ground, place the painting facing east, and offer incense, flowers, and perfume.

original: de nas mtshan mo dur khrod du song nas ras ris zhal shar du phyogs par bzhag nas dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa phul te 'byung po thams cad pa la de nas rig pa 'dzin pas ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug pa gcig pu thod pa la zhag chen po'i dud pa blangs nas snying po mnyam par 'gro ma'i rig pa bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mtshan mo dur khrod du song nas ras ris zhal shar du phyogs par bzhag nas dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa phul te 'byung po thams cad pa la de nas rig pa 'dzin pas ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug pa gcig pu thod pa la zhag chen po'i dud pa blangs nas snying po mnyam par 'gro ma'i rig pa bzlas par bya'o //
translated: “Then, the practitioner of vidyās, sitting alone on a bundle of kuśa grass, should take up the smoke of the burnt corpse’s grease in a skull cup and recite the essence mantra of Samayavajra.

original: de nas rig pa 'dzin pas slar yang ji srid du ba 'thul ba dang / 'bar bar gyur gyi bar du rig pa bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rig pa 'dzin pas slar yang ji srid du ba 'thul ba dang / 'bar bar gyur gyi bar du rig pa bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, the vidyādhara should again recite the vidyā until smoke appears and it blazes.

original: rgyal ba'i spyan gnyis pa lta bu dang / dbang phyug chen po'i mdung gi mtshon chas dbang phyug chen po rnams thams cad rig pa las dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i spyan gnyis pa lta bu dang / dbang phyug chen po'i mdung gi mtshon chas dbang phyug chen po rnams thams cad rig pa las dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: All the Maheśvaras will be brought under the power of the vidyā by the weapon of the spear of the second eye of the Victorious One and Maheśvara.

original: de nas mig sman sgrub par 'dod na rgya mtsho'i 'gram du song nas sngon du bsnyen pa ni chu dang / 'o mas khrus byas nas mi smra bar rig pa stong phrag brgyad bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mig sman sgrub par 'dod na rgya mtsho'i 'gram du song nas sngon du bsnyen pa ni chu dang / 'o mas khrus byas nas mi smra bar rig pa stong phrag brgyad bzlas par bya'o //
translated: “Then, if one wishes to perform the sādhana of eye medicine, one should go to the ocean shore, perform the preliminary practice, bathe with water and milk, and recite the vidyā eight thousand times without speaking.

original: de nas rig pa 'dzin pas gtsang mas gos gtsang ma bgos te ba lang gi phags pa tsam gyi @238a *//
analyzed: de nas rig pa 'dzin pas gtsang mas gos gtsang ma bgos te ba lang gi phags pa tsam gyi @238a *//
translated: Then, the vidyādhara, pure, wearing clean clothes, should anoint a spot the size of a bull’s hide

original: gzhi la nye bar byug pa byas nas der 'phags pa byag na rdo rje'i gzugs brnyan rab tu so sor gnas pa byed du gzhug go /
analyzed: gzhi la nye bar byug pa byas nas der 'phags pa byag na rdo rje'i gzugs brnyan rab tu so sor gnas pa byed du gzhug go /
translated: with cow dung and place there a well-proportioned image of Noble Vajrapāṇi.

original: de nas mgo bo'i thod pa lnga blangs nas dri bzang po'i til mar gyis rab tu sbar bar bya ste du ba med par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mgo bo'i thod pa lnga blangs nas dri bzang po'i til mar gyis rab tu sbar bar bya ste du ba med par bya'o //
translated: Then, having taken five skulls, one should light them with fragrant sesame oil and make them smoke-free.

original: de nas rnam pa sna tshogs gtor ma byas nas mar gyi mar me phul te de nas mgo bo'i thod pa so sor bzhag nas phyag na rdo rje'i spyan sngar bsrung ba byas pas ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug ste stong phrag brgyad bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rnam pa sna tshogs gtor ma byas nas mar gyi mar me phul te de nas mgo bo'i thod pa so sor bzhag nas phyag na rdo rje'i spyan sngar bsrung ba byas pas ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug ste stong phrag brgyad bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, having made various offerings, one should offer butter lamps. Then, having placed the skulls separately, one should sit on a bundle of kuśa grass in front of Vajrapāṇi and recite [the mantra] eight thousand times.

original: mig sman de dro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig sman de dro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: That eye ointment will become warm.

original: de nas rig pa 'dzin pa rings thabs su rig pa lan bdun yongs su bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rig pa 'dzin pa rings thabs su rig pa lan bdun yongs su bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, the vidyādhara should quickly recite the vidyā seven times.

original: du ba 'thul ba dang / 'bar bar byed do //
analyzed: du ba 'thul ba dang / 'bar bar byed do //
translated: It will emit smoke and blaze.

original: 'bar ba na thod pa de blangs nas phyag na rdo rje'i gnas su 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'bar ba na thod pa de blangs nas phyag na rdo rje'i gnas su 'gro'o //
translated: When it blazes, one should take that skull and go to Vajrapāṇi’s abode.

original: 'di zar ma'i me tog mtshungs pa sngon med pa'i bye ba phrag dgu'i dbang phyug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di zar ma'i me tog mtshungs pa sngon med pa'i bye ba phrag dgu'i dbang phyug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: One will become a lord of ninety koṭis of vidyādharas, equal to a flower of the coral tree.

original: de nas rdo rje sgrub par 'dod na ri mo mkhan gso sbyong la gnas pas ma 'dres pa'i tshon gyis bcom ldan 'das ma khro gnyer can ma dang / bcom ldan 'das ma'i snying po mnyam par 'gro ma 'drir gzhug par bya ste bri yang ku ltar sngo bsangs rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje sgrub par 'dod na ri mo mkhan gso sbyong la gnas pas ma 'dres pa'i tshon gyis bcom ldan 'das ma khro gnyer can ma dang / bcom ldan 'das ma'i snying po mnyam par 'gro ma 'drir gzhug par bya ste bri yang ku ltar sngo bsangs rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa /
translated: She should be painted green like an emerald, adorned with all the ornaments,

original: snying po'i yang g-yas pa'i phyag gis rdo rje'o //
analyzed: snying po'i yang g-yas pa'i phyag gis rdo rje'o //
translated: and holding a vajra in her right hand.

original: de nas @238b sgrub pa po ri'i rtse mor mngon par 'dzegs te mi smra bas grogs med par yang rung ste 'bum phrag bcu drug bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas @238b sgrub pa po ri'i rtse mor mngon par 'dzegs te mi smra bas grogs med par yang rung ste 'bum phrag bcu drug bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, the practitioner should ascend to the peak of a mountain, recite the mantra one hundred and sixty thousand times silently and without companions,

original: de nas bco lnga la gtsang mas gos gtsang ma bgos te ras ris la mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas mar gyi mar me sbar te de nas sgrub pa pos bsrung ba'i cho ga byas pas ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug ste rtse mo ma bcad
analyzed: de nas bco lnga la gtsang mas gos gtsang ma bgos te ras ris la mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas mar gyi mar me sbar te de nas sgrub pa pos bsrung ba'i cho ga byas pas ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug ste rtse mo ma bcad
translated: and then, on the fifteenth day, having purified himself and put on clean clothes, he should make extensive offerings to the painting, light butter lamps, and then, the practitioner, having performed the rite of protection, should sit on a bundle of kuśa grass and recite the mantra until dawn.

original: pa'i ku sha sor brgyad pa'i tshad kyi rtse gsum pa'i rdo rje byed du gzhug go /
analyzed: pa'i ku sha sor brgyad pa'i tshad kyi rtse gsum pa'i rdo rje byed du gzhug go /
translated: One should have a three-pointed vajra made from kuśa grass, eight finger-breadths in size.

original: rdo rje de lag pa g-yas pas mnan nas ji srid bcom ldan 'das ma la 'od zer byung ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje de lag pa g-yas pas mnan nas ji srid bcom ldan 'das ma la 'od zer byung ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Pressing down on that vajra with the right hand, one should recite the mantra as long as light rays emerge from the Blessed Lady.

original: rdo rje'i tsi ti tsi ti'i sgra thos te 'jigs par mi bya bar slar yang yud tsam rig pa bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i tsi ti tsi ti'i sgra thos te 'jigs par mi bya bar slar yang yud tsam rig pa bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Hearing the sound of the vajra’s “ciṭi ciṭi,” one should not be afraid, but recite the awareness mantra again for a moment.

original: ji srid rnga bo che'i sgra thos pa na slar yang yud tsam du rig pa bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid rnga bo che'i sgra thos pa na slar yang yud tsam du rig pa bzlas par bya'o //
translated: As long as one hears the sound of a great drum, one should recite the awareness mantra again for a moment.

original: rig pa 'dzin pa rings thabs su mar dang / sbrang rtsis btags pa'i byang chub shing gi yam shing gis sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa rings thabs su mar dang / sbrang rtsis btags pa'i byang chub shing gi yam shing gis sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o //
translated: One should perform a homa of one hundred and eight oblations of sesame and honey on a fig wood stick.

original: sbyin sreg yongs su rdzogs nas kyang ji srid rdo rje la 'od zer 'byung gi bar de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin sreg yongs su rdzogs nas kyang ji srid rdo rje la 'od zer 'byung gi bar de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: When the homa is complete, one should recite the mantra as long as light rays emerge from the vajra.

original: des dus gsum du khrus byas pas skra li zhing 'khyil ba /
analyzed: des dus gsum du khrus byas pas skra li zhing 'khyil ba /
translated: By bathing three times a day with that, one’s hair will become curly and frizzy.

original: lo brgyad gnyis lon pa'i rnam pa /
analyzed: lo brgyad gnyis lon pa'i rnam pa /
translated: He will have the form of an eight- or twelve-year-old,

original: phyag na rdo rje gnyis pa lta bu sngo bsangs dvang ba'i lus su gyur nas bskal bar gnas so //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje gnyis pa lta bu sngo bsangs dvang ba'i lus su gyur nas bskal bar gnas so //
translated: and will have a dark-blue, radiant body, like a second Vajrapāṇi, and will live for an eon.

original: gang gi tshe 'chi ba de'i tshe rdo rje'i rigs su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'chi ba de'i tshe rdo rje'i rigs su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When he dies, he will be reborn in the Vajra family.

original: @239a *// de nas lcags kyu sgrub par 'dod na sngon bzhin du sgrub pa po sngon spyod par bya'o //
analyzed: @239a *// de nas lcags kyu sgrub par 'dod na sngon bzhin du sgrub pa po sngon spyod par bya'o //
translated: “Next, if one wants to practice the hook, one should practice as before, with the preliminary training.

original: 'o ma dang / zan za zhing mi smra bas ba lang gi gnas su ku sha bting ba'i mal stan la gtsang zhing gos gtsang ma bgos te dus gsum du khrus byas la snying po mnyam par 'gro ma bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'o ma dang / zan za zhing mi smra bas ba lang gi gnas su ku sha bting ba'i mal stan la gtsang zhing gos gtsang ma bgos te dus gsum du khrus byas la snying po mnyam par 'gro ma bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Eating milk and rice, observing silence, in a cow pen, on a bed of kuśa grass, clean, wearing clean clothes, one should bathe three times a day, and recite the essence mantra one thousand times.

original: de nas rgya mtshor 'gro pa'i chu klung du song nas slong mo za zhing rked pa tsam gyi chur zhugs nas 'bum bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rgya mtshor 'gro pa'i chu klung du song nas slong mo za zhing rked pa tsam gyi chur zhugs nas 'bum bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, going to a river that flows into the ocean, eating alms-food, and entering the water up to one’s waist, one should recite the mantra one hundred thousand times.

original: dge 'dun la bza' ba dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun la bza' ba dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One should offer food to the saṅgha.

original: de nas ri mo mkhan gso sbyong la gnas pas gzugs brnyan 'drir gzhug par bya ste g-yas su 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gser ltar ser ba spyan gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de nas ri mo mkhan gso sbyong la gnas pas gzugs brnyan 'drir gzhug par bya ste g-yas su 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gser ltar ser ba spyan gsum pa'o //
translated: Then, the painter, who is observing the purificatory fast, should paint the image. To the right is noble Avalokiteśvara, golden-colored, with three eyes.

original: de'i nye logs su bcom ldan 'das ma khro gnyer can ma 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i nye logs su bcom ldan 'das ma khro gnyer can ma 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Beside him, one should paint the Blessed Lady Bhṛkuṭī.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gtsug tor du rab tu 'jug bzhin pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gtsug tor du rab tu 'jug bzhin pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Vajradhara, too, should be painted entering the crown-protrusion of the Tathāgata.

original: thams cad kyang padma'i gdan la rab tu gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang padma'i gdan la rab tu gnas par bya'o //

original: 'od zer de sgrub pa po la bskor ba byas te nub par 'gyur te de bzung bas rig pa 'dzin par 'gyur te rig pa 'dzin pa thams cad kyang rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur ro //

original: lcags kyu lag na thogs pas rig pa 'dzin pa stong phrag gi mnga' bdag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lcags kyu lag na thogs pas rig pa 'dzin pa stong phrag gi mnga' bdag tu 'gyur ro //

analyzed: bskal par gnas pa dang / rlung ltar 'gro ba dang / lha'i lus dang / rang 'chi ba shes par byed do //

analyzed: gang gi tshe 'chi ba de'i che bde ba can du skye bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de nas yang tshangs pa chen pos byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la 'di skad ces smras so //

original: @240a *// legs so //

translated: Then, having made extensive offerings to the painting, one should offer various types of bali offerings and

translated: One should take up the Blessed Lady’s mindfulness; by merely taking it up, one’s hair will become curly, one will have the appearance of a sixteen-year-old, one’s body will be white and radiant, and one will become a master of the vidyādharas.

analyzed: de nas slong mo'i zas za zhing shi ba'i ras blangs nas rdzas 'di rnams kyi bkru bar bya ste tsandan dang / rgya spos dang / pu shel tse dang / p'a la ka dang / r'a dza h'a ste rdzas 'di rnams gcig tu byas nas bkru bar bya'o //
translated: Then, eating alms-food, taking a cloth from a corpse, one should wash these substances with this cloth. Sandalwood, pine resin, costus root, spikenard, and royal jasmine—having made these substances into one, one should wash them.

original: mi blo gros dang ldan pas bkrus pa de la nyi ma bdun du bdug spos dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi blo gros dang ldan pas bkrus pa de la nyi ma bdun du bdug spos dbul bar bya'o //
translated: A wise man should wash them and offer incense for seven days.

original: de nas rig pa 'dzin pas bco lnga la dur khrod du song nas ba lang gi pags pa tsam gyi thang la nye bar byugs nas dri dang / me tog la sogs pas mchod do //🔽'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma byas nas de nas sgrub pa pos thod pa la nye bar 'dug ste ras des kun nas g-yogs pas srung ba byas pas ji srid dro ba'am /
analyzed: de nas rig pa 'dzin pas bco lnga la dur khrod du song nas ba lang gi pags pa tsam gyi thang la nye bar byugs nas dri dang / me tog la sogs pas mchod do // 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma byas nas de nas sgrub pa pos thod pa la nye bar 'dug ste ras des kun nas g-yogs pas srung ba byas pas ji srid dro ba'am /
translated: Then, the Vidyādhara should go to the charnel ground on the fifteenth day, apply it to a piece of cow hide, and make offerings with perfume, flowers, and so forth.🔽Having made an offering to all the bhūtas, then the practitioner, sitting near the skull, should cover himself with that cloth, and having made protection with the mantra, he should recite the Vidyā until it becomes warm,

original: du ba 'thul ba dang / 'bar bar gyur gyi bar du rig pa bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: du ba 'thul ba dang / 'bar bar gyur gyi bar du rig pa bzlas par bya'o //
translated: smoky, or blazing.

original: @242a *// dro bar gyur pas ni dbang du byed do //
analyzed: @242a *// dro bar gyur pas ni dbang du byed do //
translated: By the stage of heat, one becomes powerful.

original: du ba 'thul bas ni mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du ba 'thul bas ni mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the stage of smoke, one becomes invisible.

analyzed: 'bar bas ni skra li zhing 'khyil ba lus dkar po rig pa 'dzin pa drug cu'i mnga' bdag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: By the stage of flame, one’s hair curls, one’s body becomes white, and one becomes the lord of sixty knowledge-bearers.

analyzed: ji ltar yang ras de kun tu g-yogs pa tsam gyis kyang bdag nyid du byed do //

analyzed: de'i tshe rig pa 'dzin pa rnams la'ang cha shas sbyin par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gang gi tshe 'chi ba de'i tshe bde ba can du skye bar 'gyur ro // de nas bgrang phreng sgrub par 'dod na sngon bzhin du rgya mtshor 'bum phrag lnga bzlas par bya'o //
translated: When one dies, one is reborn in Sukhāvatī.🔽Next, if one wishes to accomplish a rosary, as before, one should recite the mantra 500,000 times at the ocean.

original: de nas ku sha las byung ba'i bgrang phreng byas la mdud pa nyi shu rtsa lnga bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ku sha las byung ba'i bgrang phreng byas la mdud pa nyi shu rtsa lnga bya'o //
translated: Then, one should make a rosary from kuśa grass with twenty-five knots.

analyzed: de nas dur khrod du song nas dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa nye bar byugs te de nas rig pa 'dzin pas ro dang / skyi bung bzhag nas bar du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Then, having gone to a charnel ground, one should anoint a square maṇḍala, and then the vidyādhara should place the corpse and the skin in the middle.

original: dri dang / me tog la sogs pas mchod pa byas nas gtor ma rgya chen po dbul lo //
analyzed: dri dang / me tog la sogs pas mchod pa byas nas gtor ma rgya chen po dbul lo //
translated: Having made offerings with perfume, flowers, and so forth, one should offer a large bali.

original: de nas sgrub pa po'i ro'i brang khar nye bar 'dug ste bcom ldan 'das ma'i snying po mnyam par 'gro ma bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa po'i ro'i brang khar nye bar 'dug ste bcom ldan 'das ma'i snying po mnyam par 'gro ma bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then the practitioner, sitting on the chest of the corpse, should recite the essence mantra of the Blessed Lady.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i bgegs char lta bu la 'jigs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i bgegs char lta bu la 'jigs par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not be afraid of the various obstacles, which are like rain.

original: ji srid tsam gdung du 'gyur te yid kyis mchod yon phul nas slar yang ji srid bgrang phreng du 'gyur gyi @242b bar du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid tsam gdung du 'gyur te yid kyis mchod yon phul nas slar yang ji srid bgrang phreng du 'gyur gyi @242b bar du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: As long as one is tormented, one should mentally offer a libation and recite the mantra until the rosary is completed.

original: slar yang sgrub pa pos 'chang bzhin pas bcom ldan 'das ma lan bdun bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: slar yang sgrub pa pos 'chang bzhin pas bcom ldan 'das ma lan bdun bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Again, the practitioner, holding the corpse, should recite the mantra of the Blessed Lady seven times.

original: de nas kun nas 'od zer 'byung ste rig pa dran pa gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas kun nas 'od zer 'byung ste rig pa dran pa gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Then light rays emerge all around, and one should hold the vidyā in mind.

original: bzung ba tsam gyis skra li zhing 'khyil ba lo brgyad gnyis lon pa'i rnam pa 'dod pa'i gzugs can nyi ma 'char ka'i 'od rig pa 'dzin pa stong phrag gis yongs su bskor ba skad cig thang gcig yud tsam la tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du 'gro zhing tshangs
analyzed: bzung ba tsam gyis skra li zhing 'khyil ba lo brgyad gnyis lon pa'i rnam pa 'dod pa'i gzugs can nyi ma 'char ka'i 'od rig pa 'dzin pa stong phrag gis yongs su bskor ba skad cig thang gcig yud tsam la tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du 'gro zhing tshangs
translated: Merely by holding it, one’s hair will become curly, one will have the form of a sixteen-year-old, and one will be surrounded by a thousand vidyadharas. In an instant, one will go to the Brahma world and will be able to remain there for an eon.🔽

original: par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Merely by holding it, one’s hair will become curly, one will have the form of a sixteen-year-old, and one will be surrounded by thousands of vidyādharas. In an instant, a moment, a second, one will go to the world of Brahmā and become Brahmā.

original: gang gi tshe 'chi ba de'i tshe dri ma med pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'chi ba de'i tshe dri ma med pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one dies, one will be reborn in the immaculate world.

original: de nas lha ma yin gyi bu mo la longs spyod par 'dod na slong mo bza' zhing ri'i rtse mor rig pa snying po mnyam par 'gro ma 'bum phrag lnga bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas lha ma yin gyi bu mo la longs spyod par 'dod na slong mo bza' zhing ri'i rtse mor rig pa snying po mnyam par 'gro ma 'bum phrag lnga bzlas par bya'o //
translated: “If one wishes to enjoy the daughters of the asuras, one should eat alms food and recite the essence mantra of the vidyā Āryatārā one hundred thousand times on a mountaintop.

original: de nas ri mo mkhan gso sbyong la gnas pas bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs brnyan chos 'chad bzhin pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ri mo mkhan gso sbyong la gnas pas bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs brnyan chos 'chad bzhin pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Then, a painter who is observing the purificatory fast should paint the Blessed One’s image expounding the Dharma.

original: de'i spyan sngar yid kyis sngags thams cad bsten par byed na lha ma yin gyi rdzas rnams dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i spyan sngar yid kyis sngags thams cad bsten par byed na lha ma yin gyi rdzas rnams dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites all the mantras in front of him mentally, one will subjugate the substances of the asuras.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i rgyal mo chen mo tshangs pas gsungs pa le'u lnga pa'o ////🔽de nas glang po'i rgyal po phur bu gsum pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyan ras gzigs @243a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i rgyal mo chen mo tshangs pas gsungs pa le'u lnga pa'o //// de nas glang po'i rgyal po phur bu gsum pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyan ras gzigs @243a *//
translated: This concludes the fifth chapter of the Great Queen of Spells, spoken by Brahmā.

original: dbang phyug gang na ba der nye bar lhags so //
analyzed: dbang phyug gang na ba der nye bar lhags so //
translated: Then the three-pronged king of elephants approached where the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara was.

original: nye bar lhags nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la bskor ba byas nas zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag byas nas byang chub sems dpa' chen po la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: nye bar lhags nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la bskor ba byas nas zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag byas nas byang chub sems dpa' chen po la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Having approached, he circumambulated the bodhisattva mahāsattva, bowed his head at his two feet, and said this to the bodhisattva mahāsattva:

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po /
translated: Bodhisattva Mahāsattva,

original: rig pa'i rgyal po 'di'i cho ga bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal po 'di'i cho ga bshad par bya'o //
translated: I will explain the ritual of this king of spells.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis glang po'i rgyal po phur bu gsum pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis glang po'i rgyal po phur bu gsum pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara said this to the elephant king Tripuṣkara:

original: glang po'i rgyal po /🔽gang khyed sems can gyi don du cho ga 'chad pa legs so //
analyzed: glang po'i rgyal po / gang khyed sems can gyi don du cho ga 'chad pa legs so //
translated: Elephant king,

original: legs so // de nas gang khyod smros shig /
analyzed: legs so // de nas gang khyod smros shig /
translated: it is excellent, excellent that you explain the rite for the benefit of sentient beings.🔽Now, please speak.

original: glang po'i rgyal po phur bu gsum pas smras pa /
analyzed: glang po'i rgyal po phur bu gsum pas smras pa /
translated: The elephant king Tripuṣkara said:

original: tshes grangs med cing rgyu skar med /
analyzed: tshes grangs med cing rgyu skar med /
translated: Without lunar day, without lunar mansion,

original: smyung bar gnas pa med par bsgrub par bya ste bud med kyi ro blangs nas dur khrod du ba lang gi pags pa tsam gyi thang la nye bar byug pa byas nas shar du mgo bo bzhag nas dri dang / me tog la sogs pa rnams kyi mchod pas mchod de de'i bha gar mig sman bcug nas ji srid du 'gro bar gyur ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: smyung bar gnas pa med par bsgrub par bya ste bud med kyi ro blangs nas dur khrod du ba lang gi pags pa tsam gyi thang la nye bar byug pa byas nas shar du mgo bo bzhag nas dri dang / me tog la sogs pa rnams kyi mchod pas mchod de de'i bha gar mig sman bcug nas ji srid du 'gro bar gyur ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: without fasting, one should practice, taking the corpse of a woman, and on a plain the size of a cow's hide in the charnel ground, having anointed it, placing the head to the east, worshipping with incense, flowers, and so forth, inserting eye ointment into her bhaga, one should recite as long as one goes there.

original: des rgyal ba'i spyan dang mtshungs par 'gyur te lo stong phrag bzhir 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des rgyal ba'i spyan dang mtshungs par 'gyur te lo stong phrag bzhir 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will live for four thousand years.

original: nag po'i @243b bcu bzhi la skyes bu shi ba de'i yan lag las skyes pa blangs nas skam por byas te bska bas bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: nag po'i @243b bcu bzhi la skyes bu shi ba de'i yan lag las skyes pa blangs nas skam por byas te bska bas bkru bar bya'o //
translated: On the fourteenth day of the dark fortnight, one should take the bone of a person who has died and dry it in the wind.

original: dri dang / me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis mngon par mchod nas phyi ma'i nag po'i bcu bzhi la dbang phyug chen po'i gnas su song nas 'byung pho thams cad pa'i gtor ma byas te dbang phyug chen po g-yas kyi lus la bzhag nas kham phor kha sbyar du gnas
analyzed: dri dang / me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis mngon par mchod nas phyi ma'i nag po'i bcu bzhi la dbang phyug chen po'i gnas su song nas 'byung pho thams cad pa'i gtor ma byas te dbang phyug chen po g-yas kyi lus la bzhag nas kham phor kha sbyar du gnas
translated: Having worshipped it with perfumes, flowers, and so forth, on the following fourteenth day of the dark fortnight, one should go to the abode of Maheśvara, offer oblations to all the spirits, place the bone of the deceased on the right side of Maheśvara, and cover it with a pot.

original: pa'i de'i yan lag las skyes pa byas nas rig pa stong phrag brgyad bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i de'i yan lag las skyes pa byas nas rig pa stong phrag brgyad bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should then recite the vidyā eight thousand times.

original: de nas dngos grub kyi mtshan ma kham phor kha sbyar g-yo bar byed de rig pa dran pas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dngos grub kyi mtshan ma kham phor kha sbyar g-yo bar byed de rig pa dran pas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Then, as a sign of accomplishment, the pot will shake. One should take it by remembering the vidyā.

original: blangs pa tsam la mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blangs pa tsam la mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By merely taking it, one will become invisible.

original: dpag tshad stong du 'gro'o //
analyzed: dpag tshad stong du 'gro'o //
translated: One will travel one thousand leagues.

original: lo stong phrag lngar 'tsho bar byed de nag po'i brgyad pa'am /
analyzed: lo stong phrag lngar 'tsho bar byed de nag po'i brgyad pa'am /
translated: One will live five thousand years.

original: nag po'i bcu bzhi pa la dur khrod du song nas ma skyes par shi ba'i byis pa'i dbang po lnga blangs nas ril bur byas te lcags gsum gyis yongs su dkris nas de nas dkyil 'khor nye bar byugs te thod pa'i nang du bzhag nas rig pa snying
analyzed: nag po'i bcu bzhi pa la dur khrod du song nas ma skyes par shi ba'i byis pa'i dbang po lnga blangs nas ril bur byas te lcags gsum gyis yongs su dkris nas de nas dkyil 'khor nye bar byugs te thod pa'i nang du bzhag nas rig pa snying
translated: On a dark eighth or fourteenth day, one should go to a charnel ground, take the five sense organs of a child who died an unnatural death, make them into a pill, wrap them in the three metals, and then anoint the maṇḍala with it.

original: po mnyam par 'gro ma stong phrag brgyad bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: po mnyam par 'gro ma stong phrag brgyad bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having placed it inside the skull, one should recite the essence mantra of Samayavajra one thousand and eight times.

original: ril bu khar bcug pas mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ril bu khar bcug pas mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By placing the pill in one’s mouth, one will become invisible.

original: lo stong phrag drug 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo stong phrag drug 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will live six thousand years.

original: dpag tshad brgyar 'gro bar 'gyur ro //🔽ma nyams pa'i ras la ri mo mkhan gso sbyong @244a *//
analyzed: dpag tshad brgyar 'gro bar 'gyur ro // ma nyams pa'i ras la ri mo mkhan gso sbyong @244a *//
translated: One will travel one hundred leagues.

original: la gnas pas bcom ldan 'das ma snying po mnyam par 'gro ma 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: la gnas pas bcom ldan 'das ma snying po mnyam par 'gro ma 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: On undamaged cloth, a painter who has taken the purificatory fast should paint the Blessed Lady Samayavajra.

original: glang po'i rgyal po phur bu gsum pa 'drir gzhug bar bya'o //
analyzed: glang po'i rgyal po phur bu gsum pa 'drir gzhug bar bya'o //
translated: One should paint the king of elephants with three goads.

original: bgegs kyi gzugs kha 'og tu bltas ba rnam par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: bgegs kyi gzugs kha 'og tu bltas ba rnam par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: One should have painted the form of a vighna with his head hanging down, in a contorted posture.

original: 'og na sgrub pa po lag na spos phor thogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'og na sgrub pa po lag na spos phor thogs pa'o //
translated: Below him, the practitioner holds an incense burner in his hand.

original: de nas ras ris kyi spyan sngar 'bum phrag gsum bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ras ris kyi spyan sngar 'bum phrag gsum bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, in front of the painting, one should recite the mantra three hundred thousand times.

original: de nas rig pa 'dzin pas legs par nges pa skyes pa'i ro blangs nas dur khrod du dri dang / me tog la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das ma mchod nas 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma byas te grogs bzang pos srung ba byas pa /
analyzed: de nas rig pa 'dzin pas legs par nges pa skyes pa'i ro blangs nas dur khrod du dri dang / me tog la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das ma mchod nas 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma byas te grogs bzang pos srung ba byas pa /
translated: Then the vidyādhara should take the corpse of a person who died a good death, and in a charnel ground, having worshipped the Blessed Lady with perfume, flowers, and so forth, and offered a bali to all the bhūtas, he should be protected by a good friend.

original: gtsang mas gos gtsang ma bgos te ro'i dpral bar rkang pa byin nas gnas pas rig pa bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: gtsang mas gos gtsang ma bgos te ro'i dpral bar rkang pa byin nas gnas pas rig pa bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Pure, wearing clean clothes, he should place his foot on the forehead of the corpse and recite the vidyā while standing there.

original: ji srid na ldang bar byed de 'jigs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid na ldang bar byed de 'jigs par mi bya'o //
translated: As long as it does not rise up, one should not be afraid.

original: de nas rig pa 'dzin pas yungs kar la lan bdun bzlas nas brdeg par bya ste gnon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas rig pa 'dzin pas yungs kar la lan bdun bzlas nas brdeg par bya ste gnon par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the vidyādhara should strike it with mustard seeds enchanted seven times; it will be suppressed.

original: de nas rig pa 'dzin pas rig pa bzlas te lag pa g-yas par reg par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rig pa 'dzin pas rig pa bzlas te lag pa g-yas par reg par bya'o //
translated: Then, the vidyādhara should recite the vidyā and touch his right hand.

original: reg ba tsam gyis kha ru sta mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: reg ba tsam gyis kha ru sta mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By merely touching it, he will see the mouth.

original: rig pa bzlas la blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa bzlas la blang bar bya'o //
translated: He should recite the vidyā and take it.

original: blangs pa tsam gyis skra li zhing 'khyil ba /
analyzed: blangs pa tsam gyis skra li zhing 'khyil ba /
translated: By merely taking it, his hair will become curly,

original: lo brgyad gnyis lon pa'i rnam pa /
analyzed: lo brgyad gnyis lon pa'i rnam pa /
translated: he will have the appearance of a sixteen-year-old,

original: lag @244b pa bzhi pa /
analyzed: lag @244b pa bzhi pa /
translated: four arms,

original: glang po'i rig pa 'dzin pa /
analyzed: glang po'i rig pa 'dzin pa /
translated: the knowledge of an elephant,

original: rig pa 'dzin pa drug gis bskor pa /
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa drug gis bskor pa /
translated: and will be surrounded by six vidyādharas.

original: rlung ltar 'gro ba bskal par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlung ltar 'gro ba bskal par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will move like the wind and live for an eon.

original: gang gi tshe 'chi ba de'i tshe bde ba can du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'chi ba de'i tshe bde ba can du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When he dies, he will be reborn in Sukhāvatī.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i rgyal mo phur bu gsum pas bshad pa le'u drug pa'o ////
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i rgyal mo phur bu gsum pas bshad pa le'u drug pa'o ////
translated: This concludes the sixth chapter of the explanation of the Three Kīlas of the Queen of Knowledge, the Blessed Lady.

original: de nas dbang ldan 'byung po'i bdag po ni 'di'i rig pas dga' nas cho ga gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas dbang ldan 'byung po'i bdag po ni 'di'i rig pas dga' nas cho ga gsungs pa /
translated: Then, Īśāna, the lord of the bhūtas, delighted by this knowledge, taught the rite:

original: ri mo mkhan gso sbyong la gnas pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs brnyan 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: ri mo mkhan gso sbyong la gnas pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs brnyan 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: “A painter who observes the purificatory fast should paint the image of the Blessed Buddha.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug phyag na padma bsnams pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug phyag na padma bsnams pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: One should have the noble Avalokiteśvara painted holding a lotus in his hand.

original: g-yon du 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje brar ma'i me tog dang 'dra ba 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yon du 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje brar ma'i me tog dang 'dra ba 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: To the left, one should have the noble Vajrapāṇi painted, looking like a jasmine flower.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi nye logs su bcom ldan 'das ma pri yang ku ltar sngo bsangs /
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi nye logs su bcom ldan 'das ma pri yang ku ltar sngo bsangs /
translated: Next to the noble Avalokiteśvara, one should have the blessed Prajñāpāramitā, blue like the priyaṅgu flower,

original: rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: adorned with all the ornaments.

original: lha'i bu rnams kyang me tog rab tu 'thor bzhin pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu rnams kyang me tog rab tu 'thor bzhin pa 'drir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: One should have the sons of gods scattering flowers.

original: 'og tu sgrub pa po lag na spos phor thogs pa 'drir gzhug par bya /
analyzed: 'og tu sgrub pa po lag na spos phor thogs pa 'drir gzhug par bya /
translated: Below, one should have the practitioner holding an incense burner.

original: de nas rig pa 'dzin pa zla ba gcig tu 'o ma dang / nas zan bza' zhing ras ris kyi spyan sngar rig pa bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rig pa 'dzin pa zla ba gcig tu 'o ma dang / nas zan bza' zhing ras ris kyi spyan sngar rig pa bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, the vidyādhara should eat milk and barley for one month and recite the vidyā in front of the painting.

original: de nas mgo bo lnga'i thod pa blangs te gsum @245a *//
analyzed: de nas mgo bo lnga'i thod pa blangs te gsum @245a *//
translated: Then, having taken the skull of a five-headed snake,

original: gyis sgyed bu gsum byas te thod pa gcig zhag gis bkang nas de nas rig pa 'dzin pas 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma bya /
analyzed: gyis sgyed bu gsum byas te thod pa gcig zhag gis bkang nas de nas rig pa 'dzin pas 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma bya /
translated: One should make a tripod of three skulls and fill one skull with blood. Then the knowledge-holder should offer a bali to all the spirits.

original: thod pa lnga pa la nye bar 'dug nas yungs kar re re la lan bdun bdun mngon par sngags pa byas nas sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o //
analyzed: thod pa lnga pa la nye bar 'dug nas yungs kar re re la lan bdun bdun mngon par sngags pa byas nas sbyin sreg brgyad brgya bya'o //
translated: Sitting near the five skulls, one should incant each white mustard seed seven times and perform eight hundred fire offerings.

original: sbyin sreg de rdzogs pa na lbu ba 'byung ste lag pa g-yas pas mnan nas brgyad brgya bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin sreg de rdzogs pa na lbu ba 'byung ste lag pa g-yas pas mnan nas brgyad brgya bzlas par bya'o //
translated: When that fire offering is complete, bubbles will appear. Pressing them down with the right hand, one should recite the mantra eight hundred times.

original: de nas du ba'i sgra thos te 'jigs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de nas du ba'i sgra thos te 'jigs par mi bya'o //
translated: Then one will hear the sound of smoke, but one should not be afraid.

original: de nas rig pa 'dzin pas rings thabs su yungs kar dkar po la lan bdun sngags pas bzhu bar bya ste skyes bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas rig pa 'dzin pas rings thabs su yungs kar dkar po la lan bdun sngags pas bzhu bar bya ste skyes bur 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the knowledge-holder should quickly incant white mustard seeds seven times and scatter them; the person will be restored.

original: rig pa dran pas stong cig /
analyzed: rig pa dran pas stong cig /
translated: Recalling the knowledge,

original: stong cig ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: stong cig ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: one should say, “One thousand! One thousand!”

original: sva ti ka ru 'gyur ro; ;de nas rig pa 'dzin pas ldong ros la lan bdun sngags pas de la thig le byas pas glang po'i dbang por 'gyur ro //🔽de la zhon pa tsam la skra li zhing 'khyil ba; lo brgyad gnyis lon pa'i rnam pa can /
analyzed: sva ti ka ru 'gyur ro; ;de nas rig pa 'dzin pas ldong ros la lan bdun sngags pas de la thig le byas pas glang po'i dbang por 'gyur ro // de la zhon pa tsam la skra li zhing 'khyil ba; lo brgyad gnyis lon pa'i rnam pa can /
translated: “One will become a king of elephants.

original: dkar zhing dvang ba'i lus /
analyzed: dkar zhing dvang ba'i lus /
translated: “One will become a white elephant.

original: glang po che la zhon pa /
analyzed: glang po che la zhon pa /
translated: “One will become a king of elephants.

original: lo stong phrag brgyad du 'tsho bar 'gyur te dpag tshad stong phrag bco brgyad du 'phur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo stong phrag brgyad du 'tsho bar 'gyur te dpag tshad stong phrag bco brgyad du 'phur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “One will live for eight thousand years and fly for eighteen thousand leagues.

original: gang gi tshe 'chi ba de'i tshe dga' ldan lha'i gnas su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'chi ba de'i tshe dga' ldan lha'i gnas su skye bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: tshes grangs med cing rgyu skar med smyung bar gnas pa @245b med de bsgrub par bya'o //

translated: The practitioner, having performed the protection rite for his good friend, should sit on a bundle of kuśa grass, put white mustard seeds in his mouth, incant them seven times, and recite the vidyā.

original: ji srid du mi ro'i kha gdangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid du mi ro'i kha gdangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: As long as the corpse’s mouth opens,

analyzed: kha nas sprul mthong bar 'gyur te 'jigs par mi bya bar rig pa dran pas reg par bya'o //

original: snying po dran pas gzung bar bya'o //

analyzed: bzung ba tsam gyis skra li zhing 'khyil ba /
translated: By merely holding it, one’s hair will become curly,

original: lo brgyad gnyis lon pa'i rnam pa /
analyzed: lo brgyad gnyis lon pa'i rnam pa /
translated: and one will have the appearance of a sixteen-year-old.

analyzed: glang po'i rig pa 'dzin pa thams cad kyi bdag por thogs pa med par 'gyur te lo stong drug cur 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will become a master of all vidyādharas, unimpeded, and will live for sixteen thousand years.

analyzed: mdung thung gi sgrub par 'gyur te sngar bzhin du 'o ma dang / nas zan bza' @246a *//
translated: “One will accomplish the spear. As before, one should eat milk products and barley,

analyzed: zhing ri bo'i rtse mor 'dzegs te 'bum phrag gsum bzlas par bya'o //

translated: Then, with the ashes from a charnel ground and clay from an anthill, mixed with milk, one should, as before, eat milk products and barley, ascend to the peak of a mountain, and recite the mantra three hundred thousand times.

analyzed: de nas rig pa 'dzin pas dur khrod kyi thal ba dang / grog mkhar gyi sa la 'o mas sbrus te rma bya'i gzugs bya /
translated: Then the knowledge-holder should mix charnel ground ash and anthill earth with milk and make a peacock figure.

analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gi tshad kyis ma 'dres pa'i tshon gyis 'drir gzhug par bya'o //

translated: Then, having gone to a charnel ground, having anointed the maṇḍala with cow dung, having made offerings with perfume, flowers, incense, and so forth, having made an offering to the bhūmipati, then the pure one, having put on clean clothes, having sat down near the skull, having placed the peacock in the second skull, he should recite mantras until the peacock moves.

original: par bya'o // de nas rig pa 'dzin pas sa la ma lhung ba'i me tog la lan bdun mngon par sngags pa rnams kyis mchod yon dbul lo //

analyzed: slar yang rig pa bzlas par bya'o //

translated: One should touch the peacock with the recollection of one’s heart, and one will become a woman.🔽She will say, “Son,

analyzed: ci bgyi zhes smra bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de la bdag gi lus su gnas par mdzod cig ces brjod par bya'o //

original: skad cig de nyid la skra li zhing 'khyil ba /
analyzed: skad cig de nyid la skra li zhing 'khyil ba /
translated: In that very moment, one will have curly hair,

original: lo brgyad gnyis lon pa'i rnam pa /

translated: the appearance of a sixteen-year-old,

original: lag na mdung thung can /
analyzed: lag na mdung thung can /
translated: and a spear in one’s hand.

analyzed: de rnams kyis lhan cig 'phur bar byed de sum cu rtsa gsum du rnam par rgyu bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: bskal bar gnas shing gang gi tshe 'chi ba de'i tshe 'og min pa'i lha'i bu rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //

translated: “If one wants to practice the lion, one should, as before, as a vidyādhara, eat food mixed with milk and, observing silence, recite the vidyā of the conduct of the vidyādhara one hundred thousand times.

analyzed: de nas thog phog pa'i shing 'o mar zhag bdun gzhag par bya'o //

analyzed: sa dkar po dang / tsandan gyi chur mnye bar bya ste thog phog pa'i shing gis so //
translated: One should knead it with white clay and sandalwood water, and with the wood struck by lightning.

analyzed: de nas rig pa 'dzin pas rgyu skar rgyal la seng+ge gnyis so //

analyzed: de nas rig pa 'dzin pas lan bdun mngon par sngags pa'i me tog rnams kyis seng+ge la bsnun par bya'o //

translated: Surrounded by ten million vidyādharas, one will live for an eon.

analyzed: gang gi tshe 'chi ba de'i tshe dri ma med pa'i 'jig @247b rten gyi khams su skye bar 'gyur ro //

original: bri yang ku'i shing las byung ba'i bcom ldan 'das ma khro gnyer can ma ri mo mkhan gso sbyong la gnas pas rgyu skar rgyal la ma 'dres pa'i tshon gyis 'drir bcug nas de'i spyan sngar rig pa 'dzin pas mi smra bas rig pa 'bum phrag drug bzlas

translated: “One should commission a painter who observes the purificatory fast to paint Blessed Lady Bhrukuṭī on cloth made from the fibers of the bṛhatī plant. In front of her image, the vidyādhara should recite the vidyā 600,000 times in silence.

analyzed: par bya'o // de nas dur khrod nas skyes pa'i ro blangs nas dri bzang po'i dri rnams kyis khrus byas nas legs par bsdams pa shar du mngon par phyogs par gzhag par bya'o // de nas sgrub pa pos me tog la sogs pas mngon par mchod nas gtor ma rgya chen po byin te ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug pas rin po ches bkab la bcom ldan 'das mas lan bdun sngags pa byas la ro langs kyi khar sreg blugs lan
translated: Then, having taken a corpse born in a charnel ground, having washed it with fragrant scents, having well bound it, one should place it facing east.

analyzed: nyi shu rtsa brgyad sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Then, the practitioner, having made offerings with flowers, etc., having given a large bali, having sat down on a bundle of kuśa grass, having covered it with jewels, having enchanted the Blessed Lady seven times, one should offer twenty-eight oblations into the mouth of the risen corpse.

original: ro'i kha gdangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro'i kha gdangs par 'gyur ro //

original: sgrub pa pos rings thabs su rkang pa'i mthe bong la seng ldeng gi phur bu sor brgyad pa bcom ldan 'das mas lan bdun mngon par sngags nas gzugs par bya'o //

analyzed: slar yang sgrub pa pos ji srid khru gang gi tshad kyi lcer song gi bar du rig pa bzlas par bya'o //

translated: Even if the sound of thunder is heard, one should not be afraid.🔽Then the vidyādhara should recite the vidyā quickly and strike the forehead of the vetāla with a karavīra flower.

translated: As soon as it is taken, one’s hair will become curly, and one will become a cakravartin vidyādhara of twelve years, except for whatever one has thought about.

translated: He will be the master of all vidyādharas.

translated: When the time comes for him to pass away, the Blessed Lady will come and encourage him, saying, ‘Son, when the power of the jewels is exhausted, you must practice again.’ Having said this, she will disappear.

analyzed: phyis rig pa'i rgyal mo 'di dran par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe'ang 'di sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa sbyin par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: 'jig rten skyong ba bzhis bcom ldan 'das ma'i cho ga gsungs so //

analyzed: ji srid ma he'i rva g-yas pa la 'od zer 'phro ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //

analyzed: @250b de nas yid kyis mchod yon dbul lo //
