translated: Having purified his body, he should make extensive offerings to the painting and various types of bali offerings. Then the practitioner should make a noose from kuśa grass, press it with his right hand, and recite the mantra until it blazes.🔽The vidyā will be seen and should be seized.

original: lag na zhags pa thogs pa /
analyzed: lag na zhags pa thogs pa /
translated: and a noose in his hand.

original: rig pa 'dzin pa bcu drug gis yongs su bskor ba /
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa bcu drug gis yongs su bskor ba /

original: dpag tshad stong phrag lngar 'phur bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa lngas yongs su bskor ba thogs pa med par 'gro ste skad cig thang cig yud tsam gyis mi med 'jig rten gyi khams su @251a *//

analyzed: 'gro bar byed cing song nas bskal par gnas par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gang gi tshe 'chi ba de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one dies, one will be reborn in a buddhafield.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i rgyal mo chen mo rgyal chen bzhis gsungs pa'i le'u brgyad pa'o ////
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i rgyal mo chen mo rgyal chen bzhis gsungs pa'i le'u brgyad pa'o ////

translated: “For curing poison, one should make a dye with water from a leaf, and with a snap of the fingers and dancing, one should mentally recite the mantra. With a white flower, one should recite the mantra seven times and cure the fever.🔽With a thread, one should frighten the grahas.

analyzed: aa rishti'i 'dab ma dang / khrag 'dzag pa dang / ske tshe rnams kyis dbang du byed do //

translated: The flower of a hundred petals causes the piśācas to flee in terror.🔽The creeper causes one to be expelled from one’s family or

original: khyim skrod par byed do //

analyzed: de nas sgrub pa pos rgyu skar rgyal la sa ser po dang / ba'i gcin dang / ljang khus nam mkha' lding 'drir gzhug pa ste 'di'i mgrin pa la padma'i phreng ba sbyin par bya'o; ;de la sgrub pa pos rin po che gsum gyis mchod pa byas nas de nas sgrub pa pos pa las byung bas dkyil 'khor nye bar byugs te sgo bzhi rnams
translated: Then, the practitioner should have the bird painted on a Thursday, with yellow earth, cow’s urine, and green, and give it a garland of lotuses around its neck.

analyzed: su bum pa gang ba bzhi bzhag par bya'o //

analyzed: bum pa gang ba bzhi po rnams la klu'i rgyal po bzhi 'drir gzhug par bya'o //

translated: Then, having taken ghee from a cow of the same color, place it in a copper vessel, and press it down with the right hand, and recite the vidyā until it smokes and blazes.

analyzed: du ba 'thul ba na 'thungs pas mi snang bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: lo stong phrag bcu bzhir 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //

original: dpag tshad stong du 'gro'o //
analyzed: dpag tshad stong du 'gro'o //

original: 'bar na lha'i lus dang / yid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bar na lha'i lus dang / yid du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: @252a *// thams cad dbugs 'byin par byed do //

original: rig pa 'dzin pa bcus yongs su bskor ro //
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa bcus yongs su bskor ro //

analyzed: gang gi tshe 'chi ba de'i tshe bde ba can du skye bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: rgya mtshor 'gro ba'i chu klung du song nas slong mo za zhing klu shing gi me tog la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg 'bum byas na klu rnams lang ngo //
translated: “One should go to a river that flows into the ocean, live on alms, and offer into the fire one hundred thousand lotuses smeared with ghee, honey, and sugar. The nāgas will appear.

analyzed: de nas sgrub pa pos 'jigs pa med pas dbus su me tog gis brgyan pa'i bum pa gzhag par bya /

analyzed: de'i steng du 'khor lo gzhag par bya'o //

original: de nas sgrub pa pos srung ba byas te klu'i stan la nye bar 'dug pas ji srid nam mkha' lding las 'od zer 'phro ba de srid du rig pa bzlas par bya'o; ;sgrub pa po la bskor ba byas nas de nyid kyi spyi bor nub par 'gyur ro
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa pos srung ba byas te klu'i stan la nye bar 'dug pas ji srid nam mkha' lding las 'od zer 'phro ba de srid du rig pa bzlas par bya'o; ;sgrub pa po la bskor ba byas nas de nyid kyi spyi bor nub par 'gyur ro

original: // rig pa bzlas pas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: // rig pa bzlas pas blang bar bya'o //

analyzed: nyi ma 'char ka'i 'od dang mtshungs pa klu'i rig pa 'dzin pa thams cad kyang dpag tshad stong du 'bros par byed do //

original: dri mnams pas lo stong phrag brgyad cur 'tsho bar byed do //
analyzed: dri mnams pas lo stong phrag brgyad cur 'tsho bar byed do //
translated: Smelling it, one will live for eighty thousand years.

original: gang gi tshe 'chi ba de'i tshe bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'chi ba de'i tshe bde ba can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one dies, one will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī.

analyzed: @252b sngon spyad pa byas na de nas rig pa 'dzin pa dur khrod du song nas ba byung gis ba lang gi pags pa'i tshad tsam du sa gzhi byug par byas nas dri dang / me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod pa byas te gtor ma rgya chen po bya'o //

translated: “On another eighth day of the dark fortnight, he should go to a charnel ground, smear the ground with cow dung to the size of a cow’s hide, make extensive offerings, and recite the vidyā eight thousand times.

original: khar bcug na mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khar bcug na mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one inserts it into one’s mouth, one will become invisible.

original: lo stong phrag lngar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo stong phrag lngar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i rgyal mo nam mkha' lding gis bshad pa'i le'u dgu pa'o ////

analyzed: nye bar lhags nas byang chub sems dpa'i zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag btsal nas rig pa'i cho ga smras so //

original: tshes grangs med cing rgyu skar med pas smyung bar gnas pa med par bya ste rig pa gang kho na tshad ma'o //🔽dur khrod du dbang phyug chen @253a *//
analyzed: tshes grangs med cing rgyu skar med pas smyung bar gnas pa med par bya ste rig pa gang kho na tshad ma'o // dur khrod du dbang phyug chen @253a *//

analyzed: po'i g-yas kyi lus la rig pa brgyad brgyar bzlas te khar bcug na mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In a charnel ground, one should recite the vidyā eight hundred times over the right arm of Maheśvara and insert it into one’s mouth. One will become invisible.

original: sa'i cha drug 'phrog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa'i cha drug 'phrog par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: 'od ma lhags pa blangs nas lcags gsum gyis de la dkri bar bya'o //

analyzed: rig pa dran pas blang bar bya ste blangs pa tsam gyis mi snang bar 'gyur ro; ;sa'i cha drug 'phrog cing lo stong du 'tsho'o //
translated: One should take it with the recollection of the vidya. Merely by taking it, one will become invisible, steal the six constituents of the earth, and live for one thousand years.

original: lha dang / lha ma yin gyi bu mo rnams dang lhan cig dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: lha dang / lha ma yin gyi bu mo rnams dang lhan cig dga' bar byed do //
translated: One will enjoy oneself with the daughters of the gods and the daughters of the antigods.

analyzed: nag po'i brgyad pa la bud med shi ba de'i lce blangs nas lcags gsum gyis dkris te yid rlung ltar 'gro'o //
translated: On the eighth day of the dark fortnight, one should take the tongue of a woman who has died, wrap it in the three metals, and one will travel like the wind.

analyzed: 'di'i tshangs par sbyad pas 'dod pa rnams la sems bskyed na de gcig pu 'jig rten gyi khams su 'gro zhing bskal ba chen por gnas so //

original: yid kyis skye ba 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: yid kyis skye ba 'dzin par byed do //
translated: He takes birth by means of the mind.

original: gtsang mas gos gtsang ma bgos te dur khrod du zla ba drug @253b rig pa bzlas na mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtsang mas gos gtsang ma bgos te dur khrod du zla ba drug @253b rig pa bzlas na mi snang bar 'gyur ro //

original: lo lnga brgyar 'tsho'o //
analyzed: lo lnga brgyar 'tsho'o //
translated: He lives for five hundred years.

original: 'ug pa'i mig sman dang lhan cig btags par bya /
analyzed: 'ug pa'i mig sman dang lhan cig btags par bya /
translated: One should mix it with owl eye ointment.

analyzed: lcags gsum gyis dkris pa'i ril bu byas nas dbang phyug chen po'i g-yas kyi lus la kham phor kha sbyar du bzhag par byas nas lag pa g-yas pas mnan te rig pa dam pa dpag tu med pa bzlas par bya ste ji srid du rnam par chad do'i

original: sgra thos pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: sgra thos pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite until that sound is heard.

analyzed: rig pa dran pas ril bu blangs te khar bcug na mi snang par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having taken the pill with the recollection of the vidyā, one should place it in the mouth. One becomes invisible.

original: lo stong phrag gnyis su 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo stong phrag gnyis su 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will live for two thousand years.

original: mig sman dang / ldong ros dang / 'o ma dang / padma ge sar mnyam par 'gro ba'i rdzas mnyam par byas te lcags gsum gyis dkri bar bya'o //
analyzed: mig sman dang / ldong ros dang / 'o ma dang / padma ge sar mnyam par 'gro ba'i rdzas mnyam par byas te lcags gsum gyis dkri bar bya'o //
translated: One should mix together eye medicine, red arsenic, milk, and lotus stamen, and wrap it in the three metals.🔽One should know the procedure for the king, and then accomplish it.🔽One who desires to accomplish a piśāca should anoint a maṇḍala in a charnel ground the size of a cow’s hide, offer a bali of meat, beer, and so on, and make a burnt offering of human hair smeared with blood eight thousand times, facing east.

translated: When all the piśācas come, one should not be afraid, nor should one make a protection.

original: bdag gi dbang du gyur cig ces brjod pa dang / de rnams @254a *//
analyzed: bdag gi dbang du gyur cig ces brjod pa dang / de rnams @254a *//
translated: One should say, ‘Come under my control.’

original: kyis smras pa /
analyzed: kyis smras pa /
translated: They will say,🔽‘What should we do?’

original: de bzhin du gyur cig ces brjod pa dang mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gyur cig ces brjod pa dang mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Saying, So be it! he will disappear.

analyzed: nyi ma re re la'ang dong tse lnga lnga ster bar byed do de rnams kyang zad par bya'o //
translated: He will give five coins every day.

analyzed: dur khrod du yi dvags dri med nyid kyi ming nas smos pa dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: In the charnel ground, one should summon the ghost Vimalā by name.

original: dur khrod du gzugs brnyan byas nas rkang pa la phur bus gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: dur khrod du gzugs brnyan byas nas rkang pa la phur bus gdab par bya'o //
translated: Having made an effigy in the charnel ground, one should nail it with a dagger at the feet.

original: de nas rig pa bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rig pa bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then one should recite the vidyā.

original: de la'ang ba lang gi pags pa'i tshad tsam gyi dkyil 'khor nye bar byugs nas mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas rig pa 'bum bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de la'ang ba lang gi pags pa'i tshad tsam gyi dkyil 'khor nye bar byugs nas mchod pa rgya chen po byas nas rig pa 'bum bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should anoint a maṇḍala the size of a cow's hide with ointment, perform extensive worship, and recite the vidyā one hundred thousand times.

analyzed: dur khrod du til gyi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste nyi ma bdun du mtshan mo sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: In the charnel ground, one should perform eight thousand sesame oblations, and for seven nights, perform the oblation at night.

original: nyi ma re re la dngul lnga lnga sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma re re la dngul lnga lnga sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Every day, he will give five silver coins.

original: ku mu ta la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg 'bum byas na nges par mthong ngo //
analyzed: ku mu ta la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg 'bum byas na nges par mthong ngo //

translated: If one makes an effigy out of charnel ground ash, sits on it, lights a fire with cutch wood, and offers into it one thousand and eight oblations of jasmine flowers smeared with fragrant sesame oil, one will become invisible.

original: cho ga 'di kho nas ming nas smos na l'anydza'i rgyal po dang / blon por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cho ga 'di kho nas ming nas smos na l'anydza'i rgyal po dang / blon por 'gyur ro //
translated: By this very rite, if one offers into the fire the name of the king of Laṇkā, one will become a minister.

original: bud med dbang du byed na aa ti mukta'i me tog gi sbyin @254b sreg byas na dbang du 'gyur te nyi ma bdun nas yid kyis gang gi tshe bsams pa de'i tshe 'ong ngo //
analyzed: bud med dbang du byed na aa ti mukta'i me tog gi sbyin @254b sreg byas na dbang du 'gyur te nyi ma bdun nas yid kyis gang gi tshe bsams pa de'i tshe 'ong ngo //
translated: If one offers into the fire atimuktaka flowers, one will enthrall a woman. She will come within seven days, whenever one thinks of her.

original: dur khrod du song nas dkyil 'khor nye bar byugs te sha chen gyis sbyin sreg byas nas nyi ma bdun pa la sha zas zin pa rnams bltas pas thar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dur khrod du song nas dkyil 'khor nye bar byugs te sha chen gyis sbyin sreg byas nas nyi ma bdun pa la sha zas zin pa rnams bltas pas thar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having gone to a charnel ground, having anointed the maṇḍala, having performed a homa with great flesh, on the seventh day, one should look at the flesh-eaters. They will be liberated.

original: dur khrod du sha chen gyis sbyin sreg stong phrag bcu byas na sha za thams cad kyang dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dur khrod du sha chen gyis sbyin sreg stong phrag bcu byas na sha za thams cad kyang dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Having performed ten thousand homas with great flesh in a charnel ground, all flesh-eaters will be under one’s control.

original: ne le'i spu'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas na 'byung po thams cad kyang dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ne le'i spu'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas na 'byung po thams cad kyang dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Having performed eight thousand homas with the hair of a mongoose, all bhūtas will be under one’s control.

original: dur khrod du bshang ba'i sbyin sreg byas na srul po'i zin pa rnams yid kyis kyang thar ro //
analyzed: dur khrod du bshang ba'i sbyin sreg byas na srul po'i zin pa rnams yid kyis kyang thar ro //
translated: Having performed a homa with feces in a charnel ground, those seized by putrid matter will be liberated by the mind.

original: khrag gis sbyin sreg byas na mkha' 'gro ma rnams dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khrag gis sbyin sreg byas na mkha' 'gro ma rnams dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Having performed a homa with blood, the ḍākinīs will be under one’s control.

original: dur khrod du botta ka'i sbyin sreg byas na'ang sha za mi 'ong ngo //
analyzed: dur khrod du botta ka'i sbyin sreg byas na'ang sha za mi 'ong ngo //
translated: Having performed a homa with bod tree leaves in a charnel ground, the flesh-eaters will not come.

original: sbrul gyi shun pa'i sbyin sreg byas na sbrul rnams 'bros par byed do //
analyzed: sbrul gyi shun pa'i sbyin sreg byas na sbrul rnams 'bros par byed do //
translated: Having performed a homa with snake skin, the snakes will flee.

original: de nas sgrub pa pos gtor ma byas nas aarga'i yam shing gi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa pos gtor ma byas nas aarga'i yam shing gi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: Then, the adept should offer a bali and perform a homa of argha wood one thousand and eight times.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba'i gzugs can gyi gnod sbyin ma 'ong bar 'gyur te 'jigs par mi bya bar rig pa dran pas stod cig /
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba'i gzugs can gyi gnod sbyin ma 'ong bar 'gyur te 'jigs par mi bya bar rig pa dran pas stod cig /
translated: A kumbhāṇḍa in a transformed body will come. Without being afraid, one should recite the vidyā.

original: stod cig ces so //
analyzed: stod cig ces so //
translated: “Recite!”

original: de de'i tshe mchog gsum po rnams kyi gcig 'dam du stsal te /
analyzed: de de'i tshe mchog gsum po rnams kyi gcig 'dam du stsal te /
translated: At that time, one of the three supreme ones will be granted.

original: ma dang / sring po dang / chung mar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ma dang / sring po dang / chung mar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: [One will obtain] a mother, a sister, or a wife.

original: ma ni bu'i bya ba thams cad byed @255a *//
analyzed: ma ni bu'i bya ba thams cad byed @255a *//
translated: The mother will do all the work of a son.

original: do; ;sring mo ni nyi ma re re la dong tse re ster bar byed do //
analyzed: do; ;sring mo ni nyi ma re re la dong tse re ster bar byed do //
translated: The sister will give one penny every day.🔽The wife will play with him and he will live five hundred years.

original: chung ma ni de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed de lo lnga brgyar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro; ;gang gi tshe rig pa 'dzin pa nyams pa de'i tshe 'di bya'o //
analyzed: chung ma ni de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed de lo lnga brgyar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro; ;gang gi tshe rig pa 'dzin pa nyams pa de'i tshe 'di bya'o //
translated: When the vidyādhara declines, then this should be done.

original: mtshan mo gtsang mas gos gtsang ma bgos te bsrung ba byas pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang; 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang / phyag na rdo rje dang / bcom ldan 'das ma la mchod ba byas nas shar du phyogs pas rig pa'i lha thams cad la bdug spos phul nas rig pa 'dzin pas dug la khrag gis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo gtsang mas gos gtsang ma bgos te bsrung ba byas pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang; 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang / phyag na rdo rje dang / bcom ldan 'das ma la mchod ba byas nas shar du phyogs pas rig pa'i lha thams cad la bdug spos phul nas rig pa 'dzin pas dug la khrag gis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: At night, having purified oneself and put on clean clothes, one should perform the protection ritual. Having made offerings to the Blessed Buddha, to Noble Avalokiteśvara, to Vajrapāṇi, and to the Blessed Goddess, facing east, one should offer incense to all the knowledge deities and perform a homa of one thousand and eight oblations of blood and poison.

original: ku sha bting ba la nyal lo //
analyzed: ku sha bting ba la nyal lo //
translated: One should sleep on a bed of kuśa grass.

original: gal te gzhon nu mdung thung thogs pa mthong na de'i tshe dri zas rdzas nyams par byas pa'o //
analyzed: gal te gzhon nu mdung thung thogs pa mthong na de'i tshe dri zas rdzas nyams par byas pa'o //
translated: If one sees a young man with a spear, then one’s substances have been damaged by gandharvas.

original: gang gi tshe bram ze mthong na de'i tshe lha rnams kyis nyams par byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bram ze mthong na de'i tshe lha rnams kyis nyams par byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one sees a brahmin, then one’s substances have been damaged by gods.

original: gang gi tshe rdo rje mthong na de'i tshe rdo rje'i rigs kyis rdzas nyams par byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rdo rje mthong na de'i tshe rdo rje'i rigs kyis rdzas nyams par byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one sees a vajra, then one’s substances have been damaged by the vajra family.

original: gang gi tshe dga' ba mthong na de'i tshe nam mkha' lding gis nyams par byas pa'o; ;gang gi tshe lha min rnams kyis nyams par byas pa de'i tshe rgyu mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dga' ba mthong na de'i tshe nam mkha' lding gis nyams par byas pa'o; ;gang gi tshe lha min rnams kyis nyams par byas pa de'i tshe rgyu mi mthong ngo //
translated: When it is destroyed by the asuras, the cause is not seen.

original: gang gi tshe klu rnams kyi nyams par byas pa de'i tshe sbos kyi glang po'i rgyal @255b po mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe klu rnams kyi nyams par byas pa de'i tshe sbos kyi glang po'i rgyal @255b po mthong ngo //
translated: When it is destroyed by the nāgas, the king of the elephant herd is seen.

original: gang gi tshe pha rnams kyis nyams par byas pa de'i tshe mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe pha rnams kyis nyams par byas pa de'i tshe mthong ngo //
translated: When it is destroyed by the gods, it is seen.

original: gang gi tshe mi gtsang bas nyams par byas pa de'i tshe glang po'i phags pa gyon pa'i dbang phyug chen po mthong ngo //🔽gang gi tshe gnod sbyin rnams kyis nyams par byas pa de'i tshe nor bu bzang po mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mi gtsang bas nyams par byas pa de'i tshe glang po'i phags pa gyon pa'i dbang phyug chen po mthong ngo // gang gi tshe gnod sbyin rnams kyis nyams par byas pa de'i tshe nor bu bzang po mthong ngo //
translated: When it is destroyed by impurity, the great lord wearing an elephant hide is seen.🔽When it is destroyed by the yakṣas, a good jewel is seen.

original: gang gi tshe sha za rnams kyis nyams par byas pa de'i tshe skyes bu gcer bu mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sha za rnams kyis nyams par byas pa de'i tshe skyes bu gcer bu mthong ngo //
translated: When it is destroyed by the piśācas, a naked man is seen.

original: gang gi tshe 'byung po rnams kyis nyams par byas pa de'i tshe sbrin mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'byung po rnams kyis nyams par byas pa de'i tshe sbrin mthong ngo //
translated: When they are disturbed by the bhūtas, then one will see clouds.

original: aarga'i yam shing gis me sbar nas mar dang; sbrang rtsis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: aarga'i yam shing gis me sbar nas mar dang; sbrang rtsis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: One should light a fire with argha wood and offer into it eight thousand oblations of ghee mixed with honey.

original: sbyin sreg yongs su rdzogs pa na rdzas lag tu phyin par 'gyur ro //🔽dri za rnams kyi sbyin sreg ni rnam par dben pa'i phyogs su ba byung gis dkyil 'khor nye bar byugs te bcom ldan 'das la gtor ma'ang phul nas ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug ste k'amba dza'i yam shing la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang /
analyzed: sbyin sreg yongs su rdzogs pa na rdzas lag tu phyin par 'gyur ro // dri za rnams kyi sbyin sreg ni rnam par dben pa'i phyogs su ba byung gis dkyil 'khor nye bar byugs te bcom ldan 'das la gtor ma'ang phul nas ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug ste k'amba dza'i yam shing la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang /
translated: When the oblation offering is complete, the object will be in one’s hand.

original: mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: “The oblation offering to the gandharvas should be performed in an isolated place. One should anoint a maṇḍala with cow dung, offer a bali to the Blessed One, sit on a bundle of kuśa grass, and offer into the fire of agalloch wood one thousand and eight oblations of ghee mixed with milk, honey, and sugar.🔽“The oblation offering to the piśācas should be performed in a charnel ground.

original: sbyin sreg yongs su rdzogs pa na rdzas lag tu phyin par 'gyur ro; ;rdo rje'i rigs la'ang sbyin sreg ni ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten la dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod cing bcom @256a *//
analyzed: sbyin sreg yongs su rdzogs pa na rdzas lag tu phyin par 'gyur ro; ;rdo rje'i rigs la'ang sbyin sreg ni ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten la dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod cing bcom @256a *//
translated: “For the Vajra family, the homa is performed in a stūpa containing relics, with offerings of perfume, flowers, incense, and so forth.

original: ldan 'das la'ang gtor ma'i cho ga byas la de nas sgrub pa pos kha shar du phyogs la gu gul gyi ril bus sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas na rdzas lag tu phyin par gyur ro //
analyzed: ldan 'das la'ang gtor ma'i cho ga byas la de nas sgrub pa pos kha shar du phyogs la gu gul gyi ril bus sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas na rdzas lag tu phyin par gyur ro //
translated: Having made offerings to the Blessed One with the bali rite, the practitioner should then face east and perform a homa of agalloch pills, eight thousand in number. The substance will be in one’s hand.

original: nam mkha' lding rnams la dur khrod du mandal la nye bar byugs pa byas nas mchod pa dang / gtor ma'ang ji ltar 'byor pa bya ste ka ra b'i ra'i me tog la sogs pa'i mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas na rdzas lag tu phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' lding rnams la dur khrod du mandal la nye bar byugs pa byas nas mchod pa dang / gtor ma'ang ji ltar 'byor pa bya ste ka ra b'i ra'i me tog la sogs pa'i mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas na rdzas lag tu phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: “For the Garuḍas, one should anoint a maṇḍala in a charnel ground with offerings and a bali as much as one can afford, and perform a homa of karavīra flowers mixed with ghee, eight thousand times. The substance will be in one’s hand.

original: lha ma yin rnams kyi sbyin sreg ni dbang phyug chen po la dri sna tshogs kyis mchod pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la'ang gtor ma byas nas g-yas kyi lus la shar du phyogs pas ka ra b'i ra'i yam shing gi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas na rdzas lag tu phyin par 'gyur ro //🔽ma mo'i sbyin sreg ni smin pa'i zas dang / sha'i gtor ma phul nas phag pa'i rul ma la chang gis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas na rdzas lag tu phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams kyi sbyin sreg ni dbang phyug chen po la dri sna tshogs kyis mchod pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la'ang gtor ma byas nas g-yas kyi lus la shar du phyogs pas ka ra b'i ra'i yam shing gi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas na rdzas lag tu phyin par 'gyur ro // ma mo'i sbyin sreg ni smin pa'i zas dang / sha'i gtor ma phul nas phag pa'i rul ma la chang gis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas na rdzas lag tu phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The asuras' fire offering is to make offerings to Maheśvara with various scents and to make sacrificial cakes to the Blessed One. Then, facing east with one's body to the right, one should perform eight thousand fire offerings of karavīra sticks. One will obtain the substance.🔽The mātṛkās' fire offering is to offer cooked food and meat sacrificial cakes, and then perform eight thousand fire offerings of pig feces mixed with beer. One will obtain the substance.

original: gnod sbyin rnams kyi sbyin sreg bya ba ni phyag na rdo rje'i spyan sngar rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i gtor ma phul nas kha shar du phyogs nas aarga'i me tog gis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyar byas na @256b rdzas lag tu phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod sbyin rnams kyi sbyin sreg bya ba ni phyag na rdo rje'i spyan sngar rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i gtor ma phul nas kha shar du phyogs nas aarga'i me tog gis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyar byas na @256b rdzas lag tu phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The yakṣas' fire offering is to offer various sacrificial cakes in front of Vajrapāṇi, and then, facing east, perform eight hundred fire offerings with arka flowers. One will obtain the substance.

original: sha za rnams kyi sbyin sreg ni dur khrod du dkyil 'khor nye bar byugs pa byas nas til gyi til mar gyis btags pa'i nim pa'i me tog gis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas na rdzas lag tu phyin par 'gyur ro //🔽'byung po rnams kyi sbyin sreg ni dur khrod kyi thal bas dkyil 'khor nye bar byugs nas gtor ma'ang ci 'byor pa phul te ba lang gi sha'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas na rdzas lag tu phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sha za rnams kyi sbyin sreg ni dur khrod du dkyil 'khor nye bar byugs pa byas nas til gyi til mar gyis btags pa'i nim pa'i me tog gis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas na rdzas lag tu phyin par 'gyur ro // 'byung po rnams kyi sbyin sreg ni dur khrod kyi thal bas dkyil 'khor nye bar byugs nas gtor ma'ang ci 'byor pa phul te ba lang gi sha'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas na rdzas lag tu phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: For the flesh-eaters, the homa is performed in a charnel ground, having anointed the maṇḍala, with the flowers of nimba smeared with sesame oil, one should perform a homa of eight thousand [oblations]. [The object] will come into one's possession.🔽 For the bhūtas, the homa is performed in a charnel ground, having anointed the maṇḍala with charnel ground ash, having offered a bali of whatever is available, one should perform a homa of eight thousand [oblations] of cow meat. [The object] will come into one's possession.

original: yi dvags rnams la n'ir ma la'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas na rdzas lag tu phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yi dvags rnams la n'ir ma la'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas na rdzas lag tu phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: For the pretas, one should perform a homa of eight thousand [oblations] of neem wood. [The object] will come into one's possession.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i rgyal mo chen mo ma mo dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / 'byung po dang / sha za thams cad kyis gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi le'u bcu pa rdzogs so ////
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i rgyal mo chen mo ma mo dang / gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / 'byung po dang / sha za thams cad kyis gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi le'u bcu pa rdzogs so ////
translated: The chapter on the characteristics of the great queen of spells, the Blessed Lady, spoken by all the mātṛkā, yakṣas, rākṣasas, bhūtas, and piśācas, is complete.

original: ma bsgrubs yang yang las su 'gyur te char ma babs pa la chur zhugs te rig pa bzlas na nyi ma bdun gyis char 'bab bo //
analyzed: ma bsgrubs yang yang las su 'gyur te char ma babs pa la chur zhugs te rig pa bzlas na nyi ma bdun gyis char 'bab bo //
translated: If one recites the spell while standing in the rain without an umbrella, it will rain within seven days.

original: khu ba 'ching ba la srad bus so //
analyzed: khu ba 'ching ba la srad bus so //
translated: For arresting semen, use a thread.

original: myos pa rnam par 'joms pa rnams la dur khrod kyi thal bas so //🔽bsung ba la ni rgya skyegs kyis so //
analyzed: myos pa rnam par 'joms pa rnams la dur khrod kyi thal bas so // bsung ba la ni rgya skyegs kyis so //
translated: For destroying insanity, use charnel ground ash.🔽For causing a stench, use lac.

original: gzer gyis nyam thag pa la aardza nas zug rngu dang bral bar byed do //🔽til gyi til @257a *//
analyzed: gzer gyis nyam thag pa la aardza nas zug rngu dang bral bar byed do // til gyi til @257a *//
translated: For removing splinters, use arjuna.🔽For removing thorns, use sesame oil.

original: mar gyis bya rgod dang / gcod par byed chu gri dang gsum gyis mche ba 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: mar gyis bya rgod dang / gcod par byed chu gri dang gsum gyis mche ba 'jug par byed do //
translated: For causing the teeth to fall out, use a crow and a razor.

original: gu gul gyi bdug pas gnas nas skrod par byed do //
analyzed: gu gul gyi bdug pas gnas nas skrod par byed do //
translated: For expelling from a place, use gugul incense.

original: 'di rnams ma bsgrubs par yang byed do //
analyzed: 'di rnams ma bsgrubs par yang byed do //
translated: One can do this without accomplishing these.

original: dper na / 'di bdag /
analyzed: dper na / 'di bdag /
translated: For example,

original: dper na / 'di bdag dpe'i don du 'chang bar byed /
analyzed: dper na / 'di bdag dpe'i don du 'chang bar byed /
translated: one should hold this for the sake of an example.

original: klog par byed pa de bzhin du 'di'ang gtsang ma bgos pas ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug ste bklags par bya ste cho ga 'di nyi ma bdun du bklag pa byas na zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: klog par byed pa de bzhin du 'di'ang gtsang ma bgos pas ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug ste bklags par bya ste cho ga 'di nyi ma bdun du bklag pa byas na zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as one reads, in the same way, one should sit on a bundle of kuśa grass, wearing a clean garment, and read this. If one reads this rite for seven days, there will be peace.

original: char ches na grog mkhar la 'dzegs te bcom ldan 'das ma stong phrag brgyad nye bar bzlas na de nas nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: char ches na grog mkhar la 'dzegs te bcom ldan 'das ma stong phrag brgyad nye bar bzlas na de nas nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is excessive rain, one should climb an anthill and recite the Blessed One eight thousand times, and then it will subside.

original: dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa gang la sbyin par bya ste rig pa thams cad 'gugs pa dang / 'ching ba dang / rengs pa dang / gcod pa dang / rig pa thams cad gsod pa dang / gdug pa'i yid skrag pa dang /
analyzed: dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa gang la sbyin par bya ste rig pa thams cad 'gugs pa dang / 'ching ba dang / rengs pa dang / gcod pa dang / rig pa thams cad gsod pa dang / gdug pa'i yid skrag pa dang /
translated: One should offer incense, flowers, and perfume to whatever one wishes to summon, bind, paralyze, cut, kill, or terrify with an evil mind.

original: kha 'ching bar byed do //
analyzed: kha 'ching bar byed do //
translated: One should bind their mouth.

original: des 'di'i las bya ste gur gum gyis chus rmongs par byed do //
analyzed: des 'di'i las bya ste gur gum gyis chus rmongs par byed do //
translated: One should do this rite with saffron water.

original: ser mos sbrul 'gugs par byed do //
analyzed: ser mos sbrul 'gugs par byed do //
translated: The yellow one attracts snakes.

original: yungs kar dang / padma'i rtsa ba las skyes pa dang / me tog bzang po rnams kyis @257b 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: yungs kar dang / padma'i rtsa ba las skyes pa dang / me tog bzang po rnams kyis @257b 'byin par byed do //
translated: One should offer mustard seed, lotus roots, and good flowers.

original: bdug spos kyis smra bar byed do //
analyzed: bdug spos kyis smra bar byed do //
translated: One should offer incense.

original: ka ra b'i ra'i me tog gis dkyil 'khor du 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: ka ra b'i ra'i me tog gis dkyil 'khor du 'jug par byed do //
translated: One should enter the maṇḍala with karavīra flowers.🔽One should offer agalloch incense.🔽One should perform these eight thousand rites of the Blessed Lady.

original: aa ka ru'i bdug pas 'phral du bdug pa dang / bcom ldan 'das ma'i las stong rtsa brgyad po 'di rnams rab tu sbyar bar bya ste yam shing gi mtshan nyid 'chad par 'gyur ba rtsa ba dang / rked pa dang; rtse mo'ang bskrad pa'i don gyis sdong bu dang /
analyzed: aa ka ru'i bdug pas 'phral du bdug pa dang / bcom ldan 'das ma'i las stong rtsa brgyad po 'di rnams rab tu sbyar bar bya ste yam shing gi mtshan nyid 'chad par 'gyur ba rtsa ba dang / rked pa dang; rtse mo'ang bskrad pa'i don gyis sdong bu dang /
translated: The characteristics of the sacrificial kindling will be explained: the root, the middle, and the tip are for the purpose of expelling.

original: rtsa bas sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa bas sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: One should perform the burnt offerings with the root.

original: rked pas ni nor 'dod pas so //
analyzed: rked pas ni nor 'dod pas so //
translated: One who desires wealth should do so with the middle.

original: rtse mos ni zhi ba can dang / rgyas pa can la'o //
analyzed: rtse mos ni zhi ba can dang / rgyas pa can la'o //
translated: One who desires peace and prosperity should do so with the tip.

original: nor 'dod pas tho rangs kyi dus su gnod sbyin yongs su rgyu bar byed do //
analyzed: nor 'dod pas tho rangs kyi dus su gnod sbyin yongs su rgyu bar byed do //

original: des na de'i nor sbyin pa'i las kyi dngos grub du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de'i nor sbyin pa'i las kyi dngos grub du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one will attain the power of the rite of giving wealth.

original: bskrad par 'dod pas bar du gnas pas mtshan mo'i snga ma la rtsa ba'i sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: bskrad par 'dod pas bar du gnas pas mtshan mo'i snga ma la rtsa ba'i sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: “If one wishes to expel, one should perform the basic homa in the first part of the night.🔽With a stick the size of a finger, smeared with poison and blood, one should perform the homa in a charnel ground fire.

original: sdigs mdzub kyi tshad tsam la dug dang / khrag gis btags pas dur khrod kyi me la sbyin sreg bya'o; ;mtshan mo phyed nas yi dvags rab tu rgyu ste des de las mngon spyod kyi las rab tu bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: sdigs mdzub kyi tshad tsam la dug dang / khrag gis btags pas dur khrod kyi me la sbyin sreg bya'o; ;mtshan mo phyed nas yi dvags rab tu rgyu ste des de las mngon spyod kyi las rab tu bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: From midnight on, the pretas are active, and they will accomplish the rite of assault.

original: sgrub pa chen po la khru'i tshad kyi yam shing la zho dang sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pas kha shar du phyogs pas sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa chen po la khru'i tshad kyi yam shing la zho dang sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pas kha shar du phyogs pas sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: “In the case of a great rite, one should perform the homa with sticks the size of a cubit, smeared with curds, honey, and ghee, facing east.

original: des sgrub pa po de'i sgrub pa chen po sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: des sgrub pa po de'i sgrub pa chen po sgrub par byed do //
translated: This will accomplish the great rite of the practitioner.

original: dbang du byed pa la byang @258a *//
analyzed: dbang du byed pa la byang @258a *//
translated: “In the case of enthralling,

original: chub kyi shing gi yam shing gis sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: chub kyi shing gi yam shing gis sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: one should perform the homa with sticks of the bodhi tree.

original: sdigs mdzub kyi tshad tsam 'dis so //
analyzed: sdigs mdzub kyi tshad tsam 'dis so //
translated: With a stick the size of a finger,

original: nyin zhag bdun du nyi ma 'char kar aa p'a marga'i yam shing khrag gis btags pa'i sbyin sreg byas na 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyin zhag bdun du nyi ma 'char kar aa p'a marga'i yam shing khrag gis btags pa'i sbyin sreg byas na 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one offers into the fire, at sunrise, for seven days, sticks of the crown flower plant smeared with blood, he will die.

original: rnam pa gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: Not otherwise.

original: nad bskyed par 'dod na p'a n'a ya'i ril ma'i sbyin sreg nyi ma bdun du byas na nad bskyed par byed do //
analyzed: nad bskyed par 'dod na p'a n'a ya'i ril ma'i sbyin sreg nyi ma bdun du byas na nad bskyed par byed do //
translated: If one wants to cause illness, one should offer, for seven days, balls of pāna, and one will cause illness.

original: ming nas smos nas sgrub par 'gyur te rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ming nas smos nas sgrub par 'gyur te rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should recite the name and practice; one should apply oneself.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i rgyal mo chen mo'i le'u bcu gcig pa'o ////
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i rgyal mo chen mo'i le'u bcu gcig pa'o ////
translated: This concludes the eleventh chapter of the queen of knowledge, the great vidyā.

analyzed: de nas lha ma yin gyi dbang po thag bzangs ris kyis bcom ldan 'das ma'i cho ga gsungs so //
translated: Then Bali, the lord of the asuras, spoke the ritual of the Blessed Lady.

original: sgrub pa pos phug gi sgo ru dur khrod du gos gtsang ma bgos pas ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug ste phug gi sgo la mngon par phyogs nas bcom ldan 'das ma'i snying po mnyam par 'gro ma stong phrag brgyad bzlas par bya ste thams cad gnas
analyzed: sgrub pa pos phug gi sgo ru dur khrod du gos gtsang ma bgos pas ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug ste phug gi sgo la mngon par phyogs nas bcom ldan 'das ma'i snying po mnyam par 'gro ma stong phrag brgyad bzlas par bya ste thams cad gnas
translated: The practitioner, having put on clean clothes at the door of the cave, should sit on a bundle of kuśa grass and, facing the door of the cave, recite the essence mantra of the Blessed Lady eight thousand times.

original: nas 'byor par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nas 'byor par 'gyur ro //
translated: All will be well.

original: dogs pa med par rab tu 'jug par bya ste lha ma yin sel bzhes bya ba'i rig pa dran bzhin pas rab tu blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dogs pa med par rab tu 'jug par bya ste lha ma yin sel bzhes bya ba'i rig pa dran bzhin pas rab tu blang bar bya'o //
translated: One should enter fearlessly, taking hold of the knowledge called “Destroyer of the Asuras.”

original: bud med la dga' ba dang bcas pas yongs su bzlas nas gtogs par bya ste dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bud med la dga' ba dang bcas pas yongs su bzlas nas gtogs par bya ste dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Having recited the mantra with delight in women, one should take hold of her; she will be enthralled.

original: @258b de nas sgrub pa pos gsum pos 'di byed par 'dod pas ri'i rtse mor 'dzegs te snying po mnyam par 'gro ma 'bum phrag gsum bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: @258b de nas sgrub pa pos gsum pos 'di byed par 'dod pas ri'i rtse mor 'dzegs te snying po mnyam par 'gro ma 'bum phrag gsum bzlas par bya'o //
translated: “Then, the practitioner, desiring to do this rite in the third month, should climb to the peak of a mountain and recite the essence mantra three hundred thousand times.

original: de nas ba lang gi pags pa'i tshad tsam gyi dkyil 'khor la tsandan na dmar pos nye bar byugs te srung ba byas nas ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug ste phug gi sgo la mngon par phyogs pas rig pa snying po mnyam par 'gro mas aa p'a
analyzed: de nas ba lang gi pags pa'i tshad tsam gyi dkyil 'khor la tsandan na dmar pos nye bar byugs te srung ba byas nas ku sha'i khres la nye bar 'dug ste phug gi sgo la mngon par phyogs pas rig pa snying po mnyam par 'gro mas aa p'a
translated: Then, on a maṇḍala the size of a cow’s footprint, anointed with red sandalwood, having performed the protection, sitting on a bundle of kuśa grass, facing the door of the cave, one should recite the essence mantra of the vidyā one thousand and eight times.

original: marga'i yam shing la dug dang / khrag gis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag bcu bya'o //
analyzed: marga'i yam shing la dug dang / khrag gis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag bcu bya'o //

original: de nas sbyin sreg yongs su rdzogs pa nas thal ba la yongs su bzlas nas gtor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sbyin sreg yongs su rdzogs pa nas thal ba la yongs su bzlas nas gtor bar bya'o //
translated: Then, when the homa is completed, one should recite the mantra over the ashes and scatter them.

analyzed: gsum po 'dir 'gyur te dogs pa med par rab tu 'jug par bya zhing lha ma yin gyi bu mo des mthong nas dbang du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de nas sgrub pa'i rdzas de blang bar bya ste gang 'dod pa de rig pas mngon par sngags nas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Then one should take the articles of accomplishment, and whatever one desires, one should take them, having enchanted them with the vidyā.

analyzed: 'khor los sems can thams cad dang / rig pa 'dzin pa thams cad kyi 'khor los bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: nyi ma zla ba dang / skar ma gnas kyi bar du 'gyur ro //

original: de bzhin du ldong ros dang / be da dang / dgra sta dang / batta ka dang / shakti ste mdung thung dang / ral gri dang / ral gri'i yu ba dang / mchil lha ma dang / gri dang / srad bu dang / mchod phyir thogs dang /

translated: Similarly, by realgar, bezoar, axe, battaka, śakti, sword, sword handle, knife, razor, thread, sacred thread,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / sa bcu la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun rnams su la'ang phyag 'tshal bar mi byed pa ma gtogs lha'i 'khor los bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will become a universal monarch of the gods, except that he will not pay homage to the Blessed Lady, the Tathāgatas, the bodhisattvas dwelling on the tenth level, and the Blessed One’s saṅgha of hearers.

analyzed: de nas rnam pa gzhan ni bcom ldan 'das ma'i sngags 'di rnams thams cad bgags par byed pa ni yungs kar gyis so //
translated: “Then, for the other type, all these mantras of the Blessed Lady are blocked by white mustard seeds.

original: de nas lha ma yin gyi dbang po thag bzangs ris kyis dam pa mchog tu gsang ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas lha ma yin gyi dbang po thag bzangs ris kyis dam pa mchog tu gsang ba gsungs pa /
translated: “Then, Bali, the lord of the asuras, will speak the supreme secret:

analyzed: lha ma yin gyi bu ga'i sgor song nas 'o ma dang / nas zan za bas bcom ldan 'das ma'i snying po mnyam par 'gro ma 'bum bzlas par bya'o //

analyzed: lha ma yin gyi bu mo mthong bar 'gyur ro //

original: de rnams ral gri sbyin pa'am /
analyzed: de rnams ral gri sbyin pa'am /

analyzed: grub pa'i rdzas gzhan snang bar byed de de blangs pas rig pa 'dzin pa ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'gyur ro; ;lha ma yin gyi dbang po thag bzangs ris kyis bshad pa'i bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i rgyal mo le'u bcu gnyis pa'o ////
translated: This concludes the twelfth chapter of the Blessed Lady, the Queen of Knowledge, explained by the lord of the asuras, Vemacitrin.

translated: From the Heap of Jewels of the Bodhisattva Collection, this is the great secret that produces the Blessed Lady, the Queen of Knowledge.

analyzed: rgyal ba zhes bya ba'i sngags kyi rgyal po gsungs so //

analyzed: bar skabs 'di gsungs par gyur pa de gang zhe na /

original: na mo ratna tra y'a ya /
analyzed: na mo ratna tra y'a ya /

analyzed: na ma a'arya aa ba lo ki te shva r'a ya /

original: bo dhi satv'a ya /
analyzed: bo dhi satv'a ya /

original: mah'a satv'a ya /
analyzed: mah'a satv'a ya /

translated: This is the supreme essence, called “the victory over the three worlds.” It is the method of accomplishing the blessed noble Tārā, which is infallible.

original: kho nar sgrub pa po rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: kho nar sgrub pa po rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The reciter should apply himself to this practice.

original: don med ba thams cad zlog par byed pa; sdig pa thams cad zad par byed pa /
analyzed: don med ba thams cad zlog par byed pa; sdig pa thams cad zad par byed pa /
translated: It averts all that is meaningless, it exhausts all evil,

original: bkra shis rab tu 'jug pa /
analyzed: bkra shis rab tu 'jug pa /

analyzed: tho rangs stan las langs nas gtsang mar gyur pas khyor ba'i chu la lan bdun mngon par sngags te shar du mngon par phyogs te btung bar bya'o //
translated: At dawn, having risen from one’s seat, one should recite the mantra over water in a clean vessel seven times and drink it while facing east.

original: las kyi sgrib pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: One’s karmic obscurations will be purified.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma'i rtog pa'i rgyal por zhi ba can gyis las thams cad 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma'i rtog pa'i rgyal por zhi ba can gyis las thams cad 'grub par byed do //
translated: In the king of the Tārā tantras, the peaceful one accomplishes all activities.

original: nye bar gnod pa med par dran par 'gyur zhing stobs dang ldan pa dang / gzi brjid dang ldan pa dang / lha rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar gnod pa med par dran par 'gyur zhing stobs dang ldan pa dang / gzi brjid dang ldan pa dang / lha rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be free from harm, one’s memory will be sharp, one will be strong, one will be radiant, and one will be blessed by the gods.

analyzed: de bzhin du rgyas pa can ni nyi ma gzhan la 'di rnams bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should perform these on other days, using the expanded version.

analyzed: bar ma la mngon spyod can barna ta rab tu 'jug pa la ming med kyi sor mo lan bdun mngon par sngags par bya'o //

original: zhi ba can dang / rgyas pa can la'ang ngo //
analyzed: zhi ba can dang / rgyas pa can la'ang ngo //

original: mngon spyod can la sdigs mdzub la bzlas pa nyid kyis de brtsams par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon spyod can la sdigs mdzub la bzlas pa nyid kyis de brtsams par bya'o //

analyzed: gang la la rnam pa de lta'i cho ga byed pa de la dngos grub 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: bzlas pa'i @260b dus su bdag nyid kyi snying gar 'dis mngon par sngags par bya'o //
translated: At the time of the recitation, one should incant one’s own heart with this mantra.

original: de'i dngos grub nges par brjod do //
analyzed: de'i dngos grub nges par brjod do //
translated: I declare its success to be certain.

original: sgrol ma'i ched du sgrub pa ni nges par myur bar bshad pa de bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: sgrol ma'i ched du sgrub pa ni nges par myur bar bshad pa de bzhin du bya'o //
translated: The practice for the sake of Tārā is to be done as explained for the swift rite.

original: sgrub pa pos blo dang ldan pas rig pa thams cad la de bzhin du rig pa'i rgyal po stobs chen po bdag gi sngags kyi rig pa shin tu dge ba dga' bar rab tu bsgrags so //
analyzed: sgrub pa pos blo dang ldan pas rig pa thams cad la de bzhin du rig pa'i rgyal po stobs chen po bdag gi sngags kyi rig pa shin tu dge ba dga' bar rab tu bsgrags so //
translated: The adept, being wise, should do likewise for all the knowledge mantras, proclaiming the great powerful king of knowledge, my mantra knowledge, to be extremely virtuous and delightful.

original: sgrub pa pos kyang bdag nyid srung ba dang / dag pa byas la de rtag tu rig pa'i rgyal po chen po 'di rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po 'dir bcom ldan 'das ma sgrol ma sgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba chen po'i sgrub thabs kyi cho ga'i las 'ga' zhig
analyzed: sgrub pa pos kyang bdag nyid srung ba dang / dag pa byas la de rtag tu rig pa'i rgyal po chen po 'di rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po 'dir bcom ldan 'das ma sgrol ma sgrub pa'i thabs kyi cho ga 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba chen po'i sgrub thabs kyi cho ga'i las 'ga' zhig
translated: The practitioner, too, should protect himself and perform the purification.

original: bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: bshad par bya'o //
translated: Always, in this great king of rites, this great king of spells, one should explain some rite of the ritual practice of the Blessed Tārā, the Great Conqueror of the Three Worlds.

original: gang la la sgrub pa byed par 'gyur ba de rnams gdon mi za bar rig pa 'dzin pas byang chub tu sems bskyed de dkon mchog gsum la mngon par dang bas 'byung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang la la sgrub pa byed par 'gyur ba de rnams gdon mi za bar rig pa 'dzin pas byang chub tu sems bskyed de dkon mchog gsum la mngon par dang bas 'byung bar bya'o //
translated: Whoever practices it will certainly become a knowledge-holder, and will be born with a mind of awakening and with devotion to the Three Jewels.

original: yang 'di'i cho gar 'gyur te ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten nam /
analyzed: yang 'di'i cho gar 'gyur te ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten nam /
translated: Moreover, this is its ritual: In a place with relics,

original: ri'i rtse mo'am /
analyzed: ri'i rtse mo'am /
translated: at the peak of a mountain,🔽or elsewhere, in a clean place, in front of an image, one should eat milk and barley-meal,

original: gzhan du'ang rung ste gtsang ma'i phyogs su gzugs brnyan gyi spyan sngar 'o ma dang / nas zan bza' ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan du'ang rung ste gtsang ma'i phyogs su gzugs brnyan gyi spyan sngar 'o ma dang / nas zan bza' ba'am /
translated: In other places, in front of the image, one should offer milk and barley-flour cakes.🔽

original: rig pa so sor sgrub pa'i ston mo'i bza' ba yongs su spangs la mchod pa yongs su rdzogs pas gso sbyong @261a *//🔽la gnas pa'am /
analyzed: rig pa so sor sgrub pa'i ston mo'i bza' ba yongs su spangs la mchod pa yongs su rdzogs pas gso sbyong @261a *// la gnas pa'am /
translated: Having completely abandoned the food of the ritual feast of individual accomplishments, one should observe the purificatory fast with a complete offering.

original: gso sbyong la mi gnas par yang rung ste 'bum phrag phyed dang gsum bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: gso sbyong la mi gnas par yang rung ste 'bum phrag phyed dang gsum bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Whether one observes the purificatory fast or not, one should recite [the mantra] 350,000 times.

original: sngon spyad pa byas par 'gyur ro //🔽mchod pa byas nas bsnyen pa'ang sa ga'i nya'am /
analyzed: sngon spyad pa byas par 'gyur ro // mchod pa byas nas bsnyen pa'ang sa ga'i nya'am /
translated: One will have performed the preliminary practice.

original: cho 'phrul gyi phyogs kyi nya la mchod pa byas nas stong phrag brgyad bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: cho 'phrul gyi phyogs kyi nya la mchod pa byas nas stong phrag brgyad bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having made offerings, one should recite [the mantra] 8,000 times on the full moon day of the month of Jyeṣṭha,🔽or having made offerings on the full moon day of the month of Kārttika, one should recite [the mantra] 8,000 times.

original: snying po sgrub bar 'gyur ro de nas las rnams su 'gyur te cho 'phrul gyi phyogs kyi nya la aa ka ru'i yam shing zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar las btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: snying po sgrub bar 'gyur ro de nas las rnams su 'gyur te cho 'phrul gyi phyogs kyi nya la aa ka ru'i yam shing zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar las btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: One will accomplish the essence. Then, one will be able to perform the rites. On the full moon day of the month of Kārttika, one should offer into the fire 8,000 agaru sticks smeared with curds, honey, and ghee.

original: me tog stong phrag brgyad rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me tog stong phrag brgyad rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will see the Blessed Lady with 8,000 flowers.

original: me tog stong phrag brgyad po rnams kyis gzugs brnyan la bsnun par bya'o //
analyzed: me tog stong phrag brgyad po rnams kyis gzugs brnyan la bsnun par bya'o //
translated: One should strike the effigy with the eight thousand flowers.

original: yang na slar yang mtshan mo thams cad du bzlas na bcom ldan 'das mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na slar yang mtshan mo thams cad du bzlas na bcom ldan 'das mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Alternatively, if one recites the mantra all night, one will see the Blessed One.

original: de nas ma mthong na dong tse lnga rtag tu rnyed do //
analyzed: de nas ma mthong na dong tse lnga rtag tu rnyed do //
translated: If one does not see him, one will find five coins every day.

original: mtshan mo bdun du thun mtshams gsum du mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas na rgyal po dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan mo bdun du thun mtshams gsum du mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas na rgyal po dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one offers into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of ghee three times a day for seven nights, one will enthrall a king.

original: myos byed kyi shing la gzugs brnyan byas nas rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa /
analyzed: myos byed kyi shing la gzugs brnyan byas nas rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa /
translated: One should make an effigy of the king out of rice flour, adorned with all the ornaments,

original: rgyal po'i yam shing gis me sbar nas thur mas rkang pa phug ste thun mtshams gsum du brgyad brgyar sbyin sreg byas na nyi ma gnyis pa la @261b rkang ba dag gis 'ong bar byed do //
analyzed: rgyal po'i yam shing gis me sbar nas thur mas rkang pa phug ste thun mtshams gsum du brgyad brgyar sbyin sreg byas na nyi ma gnyis pa la @261b rkang ba dag gis 'ong bar byed do //
translated: and light a fire with sticks of the madhuka tree. One should dig a hole with a spade and offer into the fire one hundred and eight oblations three times a day. On the second day, the king will come on foot.

original: mya ngan med pa'i shing gis sor mo drug pa'i sha la bhanydzi ka byas nas ri'i rtse mor gnas te 'o ma dang / nas zan bza' zhing 'bum phrag gsum bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan med pa'i shing gis sor mo drug pa'i sha la bhanydzi ka byas nas ri'i rtse mor gnas te 'o ma dang / nas zan bza' zhing 'bum phrag gsum bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having made a sacrificial cake of the flesh of a six-fingered man with the wood of the aśoka tree, he should dwell on the peak of a mountain, eating milk and barley meal, and should recite [the mantra] three hundred thousand times.

original: mthar zla ba nya la mchod pa bya ste mtshan mo gsum smyung bar gnas pas ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du aa shvattha'i 'dab mar bzhag ste ji srid 'ongs ba de srid bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: mthar zla ba nya la mchod pa bya ste mtshan mo gsum smyung bar gnas pas ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du aa shvattha'i 'dab mar bzhag ste ji srid 'ongs ba de srid bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Finally, on the full moon night, having made offerings, having fasted for three nights, he should place [the sacrificial cake] on an aśvattha leaf in a stūpa containing relics, and should recite [the mantra] as long as [the cake] comes.

original: legs par 'ongs sam zhes brjod par bya zhing mchog sbyin par bya'o zhes zer na chung ma'am /
analyzed: legs par 'ongs sam zhes brjod par bya zhing mchog sbyin par bya'o zhes zer na chung ma'am /
translated: If he says, “Have you come well?” and says, “Give the boon,” [the spirit] will be a wife,

original: sring mo'am / grogs mo'ang rung ste bdag nyid dang bcu gnyis la bza' ba dang / bgo ba dang / dong tse'ang rab tu stsol bar byed do //
analyzed: sring mo'am / grogs mo'ang rung ste bdag nyid dang bcu gnyis la bza' ba dang / bgo ba dang / dong tse'ang rab tu stsol bar byed do //
translated: a sister, or a friend, and will give herself and twelve others food, clothing, and money.

original: lo stong du 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo stong du 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will live for a thousand years.

original: zla ba gza' yis zin pa na rgyud mtshungs pa'i ba'i mar sar blangs nas sor drug pa'i gzugs brnyan byas te zas bzhin dang / smyung bar gnas pas aa shvattha'i 'dab mar bzhag nas ji srid zla ba grol gyi bar bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba gza' yis zin pa na rgyud mtshungs pa'i ba'i mar sar blangs nas sor drug pa'i gzugs brnyan byas te zas bzhin dang / smyung bar gnas pas aa shvattha'i 'dab mar bzhag nas ji srid zla ba grol gyi bar bzlas par bya'o //
translated: When the moon is seized by a planet, one should take ghee from a cow of similar color, make an image six finger-breadths tall, and recite [the mantra] while eating it and fasting, placing it on an aśvattha leaf until the moon is freed.

original: de la dngos grub rnam pa gsum ste dro bzhin pa la rkang pas rab tu rgyu ba dang / tshe lo lnga brgya thub ba dang / dpag tshad lnga brgyar 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: de la dngos grub rnam pa gsum ste dro bzhin pa la rkang pas rab tu rgyu ba dang / tshe lo lnga brgya thub ba dang / dpag tshad lnga brgyar 'gro bar byed do //
translated: There are three kinds of powers: If it is warm, one will travel on foot, live five hundred years, and go five hundred leagues.

original: thams cad du mi snang bar gdon mi za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad du mi snang bar gdon mi za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will certainly become invisible to all.

original: du ba 'thul bzhin pa la mi snang ba dang / sor mo nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa la mi reg pa dang / lo stong du 'tsho ba dang / dpag tshad stong du 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: du ba 'thul bzhin pa la mi snang ba dang / sor mo nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa la mi reg pa dang / lo stong du 'tsho ba dang / dpag tshad stong du 'gro bar byed do //
translated: If it is smoky, one will become invisible, not be touched by the twenty-four fingers, live one thousand years, and go one thousand leagues.

original: skyes bu bcu'i stobs 'bar te @262a *//
analyzed: skyes bu bcu'i stobs 'bar te @262a *//
translated: One will have the strength of ten men.

original: lo stong phrag gnyis su 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo stong phrag gnyis su 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will live two thousand years.

original: rig pa 'dzin pa rnams kyis mi tshugs so //
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa rnams kyis mi tshugs so //
translated: The vidyādharas will not be able to harm him.

original: zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i padma'i sbyin sreg stong phrag bcu'o //
analyzed: zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i padma'i sbyin sreg stong phrag bcu'o //
translated: One should offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of milk, honey, and ghee.

original: sol ba'i dbus su dpal lha mo'i gzugs padma phyag na bsnams pa kun tu bkod do //
analyzed: sol ba'i dbus su dpal lha mo'i gzugs padma phyag na bsnams pa kun tu bkod do //
translated: In the middle of the charcoal, one should arrange the form of the glorious goddess holding a lotus in her hand.

original: de mchog sbyin par byed de ma'am /
analyzed: de mchog sbyin par byed de ma'am /
translated: She will grant the boon, saying, “Be my mother,

original: sring mo'am / grogs mo gyis shig ces bya bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sring mo'am / grogs mo gyis shig ces bya bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: sister, or friend.”

original: des dong tse stong stsol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des dong tse stong stsol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: She will give one thousand coins.

original: nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nad thams cad rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: All diseases will be cured.

original: gso sbyong la gnas pas 'o ma dang / nas zan bza' zhing dkar po'i phyogs kyi chos gcig nas brtsams nas sngar gyi nas yam shing gi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: gso sbyong la gnas pas 'o ma dang / nas zan bza' zhing dkar po'i phyogs kyi chos gcig nas brtsams nas sngar gyi nas yam shing gi sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: One should observe the purificatory fast, eat food of milk and barley, and recite the mantra, beginning with the white lunar day, one thousand and eight times with the previously mentioned sticks of cutch wood.

original: nad thams cad nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nad thams cad nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: All diseases will be cured.

original: lte ba tsam gyi chur zhugs nas 'bum phrag gsum bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: lte ba tsam gyi chur zhugs nas 'bum phrag gsum bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should enter water up to one’s navel and recite the mantra three hundred thousand times.

original: gter thams cad mthong bar byed do //
analyzed: gter thams cad mthong bar byed do //
translated: One will see all the treasures.

original: 'khrul 'khor thams cad 'gems par byed do //
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor thams cad 'gems par byed do //
translated: It will destroy all magical devices.

original: rengs bar byed do //
analyzed: rengs bar byed do //
translated: It will paralyze.

original: srung bar byed do //
analyzed: srung bar byed do //
translated: It will protect.

original: mi'ang 'gugs par byed do //
analyzed: mi'ang 'gugs par byed do //
translated: It will summon humans.

original: shi ba sogs par byed do //
analyzed: shi ba sogs par byed do //
translated: It will revive the dead.

original: dug med par byed do //🔽zhi bar yang byed do //
analyzed: dug med par byed do // zhi bar yang byed do //
translated: It will remove poison.🔽It will pacify.

original: 'gugs par byed do //
analyzed: 'gugs par byed do //
translated: It will summon.

original: mo gsham la bu ster bar byed do //
analyzed: mo gsham la bu ster bar byed do //
translated: It will grant children to a barren woman.

original: stong phrag brgyad du mngon par sngags na sdang ba gzhan gyis mi thub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong phrag brgyad du mngon par sngags na sdang ba gzhan gyis mi thub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one incants 8,000 times, one will become invincible to enemies.

analyzed: rgyal po'i sgor srung ba byas na dgra rnams la mtshams bcad bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod @262b rten gyi drung du 'bum phrag drug bzlas par bya'o //
translated: In front of a stūpa containing relics, one should recite 600,000 times.

analyzed: ras dkar pos bgo ba byas nas ji srid du 'bar ba de srid du bzlas par bya'o //

original: 'khor stong dang bcas par 'phur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor stong dang bcas par 'phur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will fly together with a retinue of a thousand.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i las rnams byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i las rnams byed do //
translated: One will perform various activities.

original: ston ka'i sprin ltar dkar ba /
analyzed: ston ka'i sprin ltar dkar ba /
translated: White like an autumn cloud,

original: rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan ba /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan ba /
translated: He is adorned with all the ornaments.

original: ral ba'i cod pan 'chang ba /
analyzed: ral ba'i cod pan 'chang ba /
translated: He wears a crown of hair.🔽He is white, and he is in the process of worshipping Ārya Avalokiteśvara.

original: mchod phyir thogs dkar po can 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal bar byed bzhin pa 'di la mchod pa chen po byas nas 'bum phrag gsum bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod phyir thogs dkar po can 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal bar byed bzhin pa 'di la mchod pa chen po byas nas 'bum phrag gsum bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having made a great worship to him, one should recite [the mantra] three hundred thousand times.

original: yid kyis 'grub bo //
analyzed: yid kyis 'grub bo //
translated: [The deity] is accomplished mentally.

original: gtsang ma'i phyogs su chu klung 'gram du gso sbyong la gnas pas mchod rten rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i snying po can byas nas de la mchod pa byas te snying po bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: gtsang ma'i phyogs su chu klung 'gram du gso sbyong la gnas pas mchod rten rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i snying po can byas nas de la mchod pa byas te snying po bzlas par bya'o //
translated: In a clean place, on the bank of a river, having observed the purificatory fast, one should make a caitya containing the essence of dependent origination, worship it, and recite the essence.

original: bar ma la slar yang mchod rten byas nas nyi ma nub pa nas ji srid stong phrag brgyad de srid du bzlas so //
analyzed: bar ma la slar yang mchod rten byas nas nyi ma nub pa nas ji srid stong phrag brgyad de srid du bzlas so //
translated: In the middle, having again made a caitya, one should recite [the mantra] from sunset until eight thousand [recitations].

analyzed: de nas cho ga 'dis rig ba 'dzin pa'i 'khor los bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, by this rite, one becomes a vidyādhara cakravartin.

analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang thabs cig tu bde ba can du 'gro bar byed cing sangs rgyas mthong ngo //
translated: He will go to Sukhāvatī together with Ārya Avalokiteśvara and will see the Buddha.

original: bskal bar gnas par 'gyur ro //🔽rig pa 'dzin pa rgyal po'am /
analyzed: bskal bar gnas par 'gyur ro // rig pa 'dzin pa rgyal po'am /
translated: He will live for an eon.

original: rgyal po'i blon po dbang du byed na aa p'a marga'i yam shing la mar dang / sbrang rtsis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas na rgyal po dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal po'i blon po dbang du byed na aa p'a marga'i yam shing la mar dang / sbrang rtsis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad byas na rgyal po dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one wants to enthrall a vidyādhara king or a king, one should offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of sticks of the apāmārga tree smeared with ghee and honey. The king will be enthralled.

original: bud med dang skyes pa dbang du @263a *//
analyzed: bud med dang skyes pa dbang du @263a *//
translated: To enthrall a woman or a man,

original: byed pa la thun gsum du gu gul gyi ril bu'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pa la thun gsum du gu gul gyi ril bu'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: one should offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of agalloch pills three times a day. They will be enthralled.

original: aa ga ru'i ril bus stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg bya ste skye bo thams cad dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aa ga ru'i ril bus stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg bya ste skye bo thams cad dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By offering into the fire one thousand and eight agalloch pills, one will be loved by all people.

original: rgyal po'i khab tu'ang smra ba'i mchog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab tu'ang smra ba'i mchog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: One will become the best of speakers even in the royal court.

original: shu dag khar bcug nas ji srid dngos grub rnam pa gsum du gyur gyi bar du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: shu dag khar bcug nas ji srid dngos grub rnam pa gsum du gyur gyi bar du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Placing asafoetida in the mouth, one should recite the mantra until the three types of accomplishments occur.

original: dro bzhin pas ni yid gzhungs shing dpa' bar byed do //
analyzed: dro bzhin pas ni yid gzhungs shing dpa' bar byed do //
translated: By the warmth, one becomes intelligent and courageous.

original: du ba 'thul bas ni mi snang ba dang / 'bar bar byed do //
analyzed: du ba 'thul bas ni mi snang ba dang / 'bar bar byed do //
translated: By the smoke, one becomes invisible and can fly.

original: rig pa 'dzin pas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar 'bum phrag bcu drug bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar 'bum phrag bcu drug bzlas par bya'o //
translated: The vidyādhara should recite [the mantra] sixteen hundred thousand times in front of Ārya Avalokiteśvara.

original: slong mo za zhing dus gsum du khrus byas nas dpa' bo'i stan la nye bar 'dug te 'bum phrag lnga bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: slong mo za zhing dus gsum du khrus byas nas dpa' bo'i stan la nye bar 'dug te 'bum phrag lnga bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Eating alms, bathing three times a day, sitting on a hero's seat, he should recite five hundred thousand times.

original: de nas yid kyis 'dod pa'i dngos grub 'byung ste lha rnams kyis lhan cig gnas shing gang 'dod pa de rnyed do //
analyzed: de nas yid kyis 'dod pa'i dngos grub 'byung ste lha rnams kyis lhan cig gnas shing gang 'dod pa de rnyed do //
translated: Then, the desired accomplishments will arise mentally. The gods will dwell together and one will obtain whatever is desired.🔽Then, placing red arsenic in a white casket wrapped in cloth, one should recite [the mantra] until the three types of accomplishments occur.

original: de nas za ma tog dkar po yi ges dkris pa ldong ros bcug nas ji srid dngos grub rnam pa gsum du gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas za ma tog dkar po yi ges dkris pa ldong ros bcug nas ji srid dngos grub rnam pa gsum du gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should recite [the mantra] until the three types of accomplishments occur.

original: dro bzhin pa la yid gzhungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dro bzhin pa la yid gzhungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites while warm, one will become intelligent.

original: du ba 'thul bzhin pa la mi snang ba dang / 'bar bar byed do //
analyzed: du ba 'thul bzhin pa la mi snang ba dang / 'bar bar byed do //
translated: If one recites while smoking, one will become invisible and will be able to set things on fire.

original: rig pa 'dzin pas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar 'bum phrag bcu drug bzlas @263b bar bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar 'bum phrag bcu drug bzlas @263b bar bya'o //
translated: The vidyādhara should recite in front of Ārya Avalokiteśvara sixteen thousand times.

original: slong mo za zhing mi smra bar ku sha bting ba la nyal nas na ga ge sar gyis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: slong mo za zhing mi smra bar ku sha bting ba la nyal nas na ga ge sar gyis sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: Eating alms, without speaking, one should sleep on kuśa grass and perform eight thousand oblations of ironwood blossoms.

original: nyi ma bdun pa la 'dod pa'i bu mo rnyed do //
analyzed: nyi ma bdun pa la 'dod pa'i bu mo rnyed do //
translated: On the seventh day, one will obtain a desired maiden.

original: mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya'o //
translated: One should perform eight thousand oblations of ghee.

original: nyi ma bdun pa la mchog tu yid gzhungs shing dpa' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma bdun pa la mchog tu yid gzhungs shing dpa' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: On the seventh day, one will become supremely intelligent and courageous.

original: dga' ba 'khyil ba'i me tog gis stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg byas na bud med dang / skyes pa rnam par ldang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dga' ba 'khyil ba'i me tog gis stong phrag brgyad sbyin sreg byas na bud med dang / skyes pa rnam par ldang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one offers eight thousand oblations of flowers of the aśoka tree, one will enthrall women and men.

translated: For enthrallment, on the full moon, fasting day and night, in front of Ārya Avalokiteśvara, having lit a fire with sticks of the bodhi tree, one should offer into it eight thousand sesame seed oblations.

original: seng ldeng la phur bu sor bzhi ba'i tshad byas nas phyogs bzhir gdab par byas te mtshams bcings pa byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: seng ldeng la phur bu sor bzhi ba'i tshad byas nas phyogs bzhir gdab par byas te mtshams bcings pa byas par 'gyur ro //

original: mig sman ldong ros grub par 'dod pas zla ba gcig tu 'o ma dang / nas zan bza' zhing nag po'i brgyad pa la mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas pas ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du gzugs brnyan gyi spyan sngar aa shvattha'i 'dab ma bzhi la bzhag nas bzhi pas mnan te ji srid dngos grub rnam pa gsum du gyur🔽pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: mig sman ldong ros grub par 'dod pas zla ba gcig tu 'o ma dang / nas zan bza' zhing nag po'i brgyad pa la mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas pas ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du gzugs brnyan gyi spyan sngar aa shvattha'i 'dab ma bzhi la bzhag nas bzhi pas mnan te ji srid dngos grub rnam pa gsum du gyur🔽pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One who desires to accomplish collyrium should eat a diet of milk and barley for one month, and on the eighth day of the dark fortnight, fasting for three nights, in front of an image in a caitya containing relics, one should place the collyrium on four aśvattha leaves, cover it with the fourth leaf, and recite the mantra until the three types of siddhi occur.

original: zhal lce ba la rig pa bzlas pa nyid dang / gdong la yongs su bzlas pas rgyal bar 'gyur @264a *//
analyzed: zhal lce ba la rig pa bzlas pa nyid dang / gdong la yongs su bzlas pas rgyal bar 'gyur @264a *//
translated: By reciting the mantra over the face, one will be victorious.

analyzed: ro; ;khros pa'i mdun yongs su bzlas na rab tu zhum par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites the mantra in front of an angry person, he will become subdued.

original: yug sa mo dbang du bya bar 'dod na nag po'i brgyad pa la mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas te 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar me tog dkar po'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste gang don du gnyer ba de la mchog
analyzed: yug sa mo dbang du bya bar 'dod na nag po'i brgyad pa la mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas te 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar me tog dkar po'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste gang don du gnyer ba de la mchog
translated: If one wishes to enthrall a woman, one should fast for three nights on the eighth day of the dark fortnight and offer into the fire one thousand and eight white flowers in front of Ārya Avalokiteśvara.

original: sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: sbyin par byed do //
translated: She will grant one whatever boon one desires.

original: yungs kar dkar pos mche ba can thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor 'ching ba ni /
analyzed: yungs kar dkar pos mche ba can thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor 'ching ba ni /
translated: By binding the maṇḍala of all fanged beings with white mustard seeds,

original: seng+ge dang / stag dang / chom rkun dang / glang po che'i nang du song bas dran par bya zhing gso sbyong la gnas pas dus gsum du khrus bya zhing byang chub tu sems bskyed cing byams pa la gnas pas sems can thams cad la phan par 'dod pas ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten dang /
analyzed: seng+ge dang / stag dang / chom rkun dang / glang po che'i nang du song bas dran par bya zhing gso sbyong la gnas pas dus gsum du khrus bya zhing byang chub tu sems bskyed cing byams pa la gnas pas sems can thams cad la phan par 'dod pas ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten dang /
translated: One should remember to observe the purificatory fast while in the midst of lions, tigers, robbers, and elephants.

original: gzugs brnyan gyi spyan sngar 'bum phrag gsum bzlas so //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi spyan sngar 'bum phrag gsum bzlas so //
translated: One should recite the mantra three hundred thousand times in front of a stūpa containing relics or an image of the Tathāgata.

analyzed: de nas 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug 'drir gzhug par bya ste ma nyams pa'i ras mnyen pa la ston kha'i sprin ltar dkar ba /

analyzed: padma la gnas pa /

original: padma phyag na bsnams pa /
analyzed: padma phyag na bsnams pa /

analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa / ral ba'i cod pan 'chang ba /
translated: adorned with all the ornaments,🔽wearing a crown of hair tied in a topknot,

original: dar dang / ras kyi sham thabs can no //
analyzed: dar dang / ras kyi sham thabs can no //
translated: and wearing silk and cotton garments.

original: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten dang / gzugs brnyan gyi spyan sngar ras ris bzhugs su @264b gsol nas 'bum phrag gsum bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten dang / gzugs brnyan gyi spyan sngar ras ris bzhugs su @264b gsol nas 'bum phrag gsum bzlas par bya'o //

translated: Then, on the full moon, one should make a large offering to the Blessed Buddha, and then fast for three nights and perform twenty-four thousand fire offerings of agalloch sticks smeared with curds, honey, and ghee.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug las 'od zer 'byung ste sa g-yo bar 'byung zhing rnga bo che'i sgra sgrogs par byed pa dang / mar me'i rtse mo 'phel ba dang / me tog gi chun po g-yo ba dang / ras ris 'gul bar byed de de nas grub bar 'gyur ro //

translated: Noble Avalokiteśvara will emit light, the earth will quake, and the sound of a great drum will be heard. The flame of the lamp will increase, the bunch of flowers will shake, and the painting will move. Then one will be successful.

original: de nas las rnams dge bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas las rnams dge bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then all activities will be auspicious.

original: nor sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: nor sbyin par byed do //

original: dngos grub thams cad kyis dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad kyis dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will be delighted by all powers.

original: dbang du gyur nas gnas so //
analyzed: dbang du gyur nas gnas so //
translated: Having become powerful, one will remain.

original: de nas mig sman sgrub par 'dod na rna ba'i mig sman aa shvattha'i 'dab ma'i nang du btum par byas nas ji srid dngos grub rnam pa gsum du gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //🔽tsandan dmar po las byung ba'i sor bcu drug pa'am /
