translated: Then, if one wishes to perform the sādhana of eye ointment, one should wrap the eye ointment in the leaf of a plant from which a plant for the ear has grown, and recite the mantra until the three types of siddhi occur.🔽One should have a staff made from red sandalwood, sixteen fingerbreadths long,

original: sor bcu pa'i dbyug pa'i shing byed du gzhug go /
analyzed: sor bcu pa'i dbyug pa'i shing byed du gzhug go /
translated: or ten fingerbreadths long.

analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi drung du ji srid dngos grub rnam pa gsum du gyur gyi bar du 'bum phrag gsum bzlas bar bya'o //
translated: In front of Ārya Avalokiteśvara, one should recite the mantra three hundred thousand times until the three types of siddhi occur.

original: gang byed pa de thams cad de byed du gzhug bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang byed pa de thams cad de byed du gzhug bar bya'o //
translated: One should have all that is to be done done by him.

original: cho 'phrul gyi phyogs nas brtsams nas gso sbyong @265a *//
analyzed: cho 'phrul gyi phyogs nas brtsams nas gso sbyong @265a *//
translated: Beginning from the side of the miracles,

analyzed: can gyi dus gsum du khrus bya zhing gos lan gsum du brjes la 'bum bzlas par bya'o //
translated: one should bathe three times a day, change one’s clothes three times, and recite the mantra one hundred thousand times.

original: bsnyams pa'i ras la lha 'drir gzhug par bya ste ston ka'i sprin ltar dkar ba /
analyzed: bsnyams pa'i ras la lha 'drir gzhug par bya ste ston ka'i sprin ltar dkar ba /
translated: One should have a painting made on linen cloth, white like an autumn cloud,

original: phyag na padma bsnams pa /
analyzed: phyag na padma bsnams pa /
translated: holding a lotus in his hand,

original: rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa /
translated: adorned with all the ornaments,

original: ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten du dbugs rdub bzhin pas lag pa gnyis su dz'i bas bkang la ral pa'i cod pan 'dzin cing mchod phyir thogs dkar po can padma'i phreng ba 'chang ba'o //

translated: inhaling in a caitya containing relics, with both hands filled with jasmine flowers, holding a crest jewel, wearing a white sacred thread, and holding a garland of lotuses.

original: de nas dkar po'i brgyad nas brtsams nas ring bsrel dang bcas pa'i mchod rten dang / ras ris la padma dkar po'i sbyin sreg bya zhing 'bum phrag bcu gnyis bzlas par bya'o //

translated: Then, beginning on the eighth day of a bright half-month, one should offer into the fire white lotuses in a caitya containing relics and recite [the mantra] twelve hundred thousand times.

analyzed: cho ga gzhan ni rig pa 'dzin pas sgrub pa byed par 'dod pas log 'dren rnam par 'joms pa'i cho ga'i rgyal po ni yungs kar la tsha ba'i til mar gyis btags pa'i sbyin sreg stong phrag brgyad bya ste dpag tshad stong du 'bros par byed do //
translated: “Another rite: a knowledge-holder who wishes to perform the practice should offer into the fire one thousand oblations of mustard seeds smeared with hot oil. He will cause the māras to flee for a thousand leagues.

original: de nas rig pa bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rig pa bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Then he should accomplish the knowledge.

original: rnam pa gzhan du dug 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du dug 'joms par byed do //
translated: Alternatively, he will destroy the poison.

original: pha rol gyi rig pa bcing bar 'dod na /
analyzed: pha rol gyi rig pa bcing bar 'dod na /
translated: “If one wishes to bind the knowledge of an adversary,

original: ming nas smos te ras kyi kha tshar la brgyad brgyar mngon par sngags nas mdud ba bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: ming nas smos te ras kyi kha tshar la brgyad brgyar mngon par sngags nas mdud ba bcing bar bya'o //
translated: one should incant one hundred and eight times the fringe of a cloth, and tie it.

original: gal te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rang byung du byon yang des kyang ji srid rig pa 'dzin pas @265b dkrol gyi bar du dkrol bar mi nus so //
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rang byung du byon yang des kyang ji srid rig pa 'dzin pas @265b dkrol gyi bar du dkrol bar mi nus so //
translated: Even if the Blessed Buddha himself were to come, he would not be able to untie it, let alone a knowledge-holder.

original: zhi bar 'dod pas sna ma'i me tog stong phrag brgyad dbul bar bya ste zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhi bar 'dod pas sna ma'i me tog stong phrag brgyad dbul bar bya ste zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one wishes for peace, one should offer one thousand and eight jasmine flowers; there will be peace.

original: slong mo za bas bye ba yongs su bzlas par bya ste mngon sum du bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag med padma'i gdan la bzhugs pa mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slong mo za bas bye ba yongs su bzlas par bya ste mngon sum du bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag med padma'i gdan la bzhugs pa mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Eating alms, one should recite the mantra ten million times; one will see the blessed Amitābha sitting on a lotus seat.

original: rig pa 'dis stong phrag bcur bzlas pas gzhan nad kyis btab pa rab tu 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: rig pa 'dis stong phrag bcur bzlas pas gzhan nad kyis btab pa rab tu 'joms par byed do //
translated: By reciting this awareness ten thousand times, one will destroy the afflictions of others.

original: slong mo za zhing bye ba yongs su bzlas na bcom ldan 'das mthong ste mchog gsum rtsol bar mdzad do //
analyzed: slong mo za zhing bye ba yongs su bzlas na bcom ldan 'das mthong ste mchog gsum rtsol bar mdzad do //
translated: Eating alms, one should recite the mantra ten million times; one will see the Blessed One and will be granted the three boons.

original: sems can thams cad dbang du byed pa dang / mi snang ba dang / lha ma yin gyi khyim du 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dbang du byed pa dang / mi snang ba dang / lha ma yin gyi khyim du 'dug pa'o //
translated: One will enthrall all beings, become invisible, and enter the abode of the asuras.

original: ri'i rtse mor 'dzegs nas bye ba yongs su bzlas na lha thams cad dbang du 'gyur zhing rtag tu'ang mthong ba rtsol bar byed /
analyzed: ri'i rtse mor 'dzegs nas bye ba yongs su bzlas na lha thams cad dbang du 'gyur zhing rtag tu'ang mthong ba rtsol bar byed /
translated: Having climbed to the peak of a mountain, one should recite the mantra ten million times; all the gods will be enthralled and will always grant what one desires.

original: padma can gyi mtshor padma dkar po'i sbyin sreg stong phrag bcu bya'o //
analyzed: padma can gyi mtshor padma dkar po'i sbyin sreg stong phrag bcu bya'o //
translated: On a lotus lake, one should offer into the fire one thousand and eight white lotuses.

original: rgyal po dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal po dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: One will enthrall a king.

original: bklags pa tsam gyis thams cad yongs su 'grub par 'gyur te 'dod pas nye bar bzhag pa ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: bklags pa tsam gyis thams cad yongs su 'grub par 'gyur te 'dod pas nye bar bzhag pa ni ma gtogs so //
translated: By merely reciting it, everything will be accomplished, except for what is placed in the desire realm.

original: mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas te me long la yongs su bzlas nas sbyin sreg gi thal bas khye'u 'am /
analyzed: mtshan mo gsum du smyung bar gnas te me long la yongs su bzlas nas sbyin sreg gi thal bas khye'u 'am /
translated: Having fasted for three nights, one should recite over a mirror and show it to a boy or a girl with the ashes of a burnt corpse.

original: bu mo la bstan bar bya ste ma nyams ma zad par mthong ngo //
analyzed: bu mo la bstan bar bya ste ma nyams ma zad par mthong ngo //
translated: One will see them without being harmed or exhausted.

original: mtho ba'i sen rtsi dang / dri'i til mar gyis byugs nas byis pa rnams la bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: mtho ba'i sen rtsi dang / dri'i til mar gyis byugs nas byis pa rnams la bstan par bya'o //
translated: Having anointed them with high nail polish and fragrant sesame oil, one should show it to the children.

original: snod chus gang bar byas nas thams cad la bstan par bya ste thams cad @266a *//
analyzed: snod chus gang bar byas nas thams cad la bstan par bya ste thams cad @266a *//
translated: Having filled a vessel with water, one should show it to everyone.

original: mthong zhing sems can thams cad dbang du byed do //
analyzed: mthong zhing sems can thams cad dbang du byed do //
translated: Everyone will see it and all beings will be brought under control.

original: lan bdun du bzlas pas dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan bdun du bzlas pas dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: By reciting it seven times, they will be brought under control.

original: grong du rab tu zhugs nas bza' ba don du gnyer na stong bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: grong du rab tu zhugs nas bza' ba don du gnyer na stong bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having entered a village, if one seeks food, one should recite it a thousand times.

original: bza' ba rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bza' ba rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will obtain food.

original: chom rkun gyi 'jigs pa la bzlas pas rengs par byed do //
analyzed: chom rkun gyi 'jigs pa la bzlas pas rengs par byed do //
translated: In the case of the fear of thieves, by reciting it, they will be paralyzed.

original: bye ba bzlas pas las thams cad nus par 'gyur ro;/
analyzed: bye ba bzlas pas las thams cad nus par 'gyur ro;/
translated: By reciting ten million times, one will be able to perform all activities.

original: zla ba gzas bzung ba nas ba ra ha ka mi ka'i rtsa ba blangs nas lag pa kha sbyar bas mnan te ji srid dngos grub rnam pa gsum du gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba gzas bzung ba nas ba ra ha ka mi ka'i rtsa ba blangs nas lag pa kha sbyar bas mnan te ji srid dngos grub rnam pa gsum du gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: When there is an eclipse of the moon, one should take the root of the moon lily plant, cover one’s hands with it, and recite the mantra until the three kinds of superknowledge arise.

original: nyi ma gzas bzung ba na 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar ji srid dngos grub rnam pa gsum du gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma gzas bzung ba na 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi spyan sngar ji srid dngos grub rnam pa gsum du gyur pa de srid du bzlas par bya'o //
translated: When there is an eclipse of the sun, one should recite the mantra in front of Avalokiteśvara until the three kinds of superknowledge arise.

original: chu klung du song zhing 'o ma dang / nas zan za zhing bye ba bzlas na klu thams cad 'ong bar byed cing de rnams dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu klung du song zhing 'o ma dang / nas zan za zhing bye ba bzlas na klu thams cad 'ong bar byed cing de rnams dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: One should go to a river, eat milk and barley, and recite the mantra ten million times. All the nāgas will come and will be under one’s control.

original: de nas sgrub pa pos klu'i gnas kyi dngos grub 'byung bar bya ste; klu'i gnas thams cad du ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin rang gi khyim bzhin du rnam par rgyu bar byed do //
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa pos klu'i gnas kyi dngos grub 'byung bar bya ste; klu'i gnas thams cad du ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin rang gi khyim bzhin du rnam par rgyu bar byed do //
translated: Then the practitioner should bring about the appearance of the siddhi of the nāga abode. In all the nāga abodes, one will be able to move about as one pleases, just like in one’s own house.

original: klu'i gnas su song nas 'o thug gis lhung bzed bkang nas ji srid klu mgo bo bdun pa 'ong bar byed pa de srid du rig pa bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: klu'i gnas su song nas 'o thug gis lhung bzed bkang nas ji srid klu mgo bo bdun pa 'ong bar byed pa de srid du rig pa bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Having gone to the abode of the nāgas, one should fill one’s begging bowl with milk-rice and recite the vidyā until a seven-headed nāga appears.

original: rin po che rnams kyang sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: rin po che rnams kyang sbyin par byed do //
translated: He will give one jewels.

original: sa la rgyal po'i gter 'don pa'am /
analyzed: sa la rgyal po'i gter 'don pa'am /
translated: One will obtain the treasure of a king on the earth.

original: 'ching bar byed do //
analyzed: 'ching bar byed do //
translated: One will be able to bind him.

original: de @266b nas gcig tu yang dag par blangs par bya ste ma blangs na klu'i 'ching ba lnga 'ong bar byed do //
analyzed: de @266b nas gcig tu yang dag par blangs par bya ste ma blangs na klu'i 'ching ba lnga 'ong bar byed do //
translated: Then, one should take him to a solitary place. If one does not take him, he will bring five nāga bonds.

original: sngags 'di nyid kyis stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig tu chu klung gi 'gram du bzlas pa dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngags 'di nyid kyis stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig tu chu klung gi 'gram du bzlas pa dbul bar bya'o //
translated: With this very mantra, one should recite twenty-one thousand times on the bank of a river and one will become free from poverty.
